Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room!”
Reviews.Author: CbusTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche 3 times, and have always had a wonderful stay. The rooms (we were in 501 in January) are a nice size and we had a fantastic view of the St Severin church from our window. The staff are helpful and polite - we asked the front desk to help us make a couple of restaurant reservations and she did so with a smile. I've never had the in-house breakfast, since there are so many places for a chocolate croissant just steps away! Very close to the RER and Metro stations, and a 3 minute walk from Notre Dame. Also, the lobby always smells just fabulous - a nice homey touch that makes a great first impression. My boyfriend and I have trouble with the half-covered shower, but this is a minor inconvenience. Don't forget to bring your own conditioner for your hair and a washcloth, as these are not provided. Or you can just buy some at the Monoprix a couple blocks away! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good Small Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cemcintosh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here the first week of March. This is a nice, adequate hotel, that is best for its value. The hotel, like most others throughout Europe, is small. I booked the hotel online and booked what I thought was a King room, turns it out was a King Double Room, which was French for - just a small room with a double bed... You get what you pay for - no King sized beds or large rooms in this hotel. The hotel is located near Notre Dame, and it an easy walking distance to many of the shops and hotels in the Latin Quarter and St. Germain area. If you are looking for a nice inexpensive place to stay, I would recommend this hotel. If you are looking for top tier amenities and high end hotel, you will need to up your budget and stay somewhere else. Next time I am in Paris I may splurge and spend more on the hotel, however if I were staying in the same budget I would strongly consider staying here again. The front desk staff was extremely helpful to us - they made a few reservations at restaurants for us and booked our airport transportation. I would strongly recommend researching restaurants prior to your trip - there are a lot of really good restaurants in Paris, and a lot of really bad ones too that will quickly take your money for an overpriced meal that taste terrible. The good ones are great and the bad ones are terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Christoph J Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days in the hotel. Very nice and helpful staff, nice rooms (a bit small like in almost all hotels in Paris), very tasteful and charming interior design, and right in the Quartier Latin and only 5 min to walk to Notre Dame. Can really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Three day weekend in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MADJohnny75
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, well located and very close to inexpensive and nice restaurants with menu options. The triple room is large and has great views ...

Reviews.Title: “A great find”
Reviews.Author: Mandste
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location and although the rooms are typically small for Paris, they are well kitted out and spotlessly clean. All the staff here were very helpful. The hotel is only a few minutes walk from the metro, RER and Notre Dame and the whole area has a lovely friendly feel to it. We had the hotel breakfast one morning during our stay and even though it was more expensive than other places, it was very tasty and there was ample choice. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A must stay for Paris”
Reviews.Author: Vicki K
Reviews.Content: Wow what a magnifient hotel with views of the Eiffel tower and very central to walk to most places. No breakfast included and being typically Australian loved my cereal which no-one offered anywhere!! Try and get the 6th floor as you get the view of the eiffel tower (Ithink it was 601). The staff could have been friendlier but I feel as though it was just the 'Parisian way" lol. Hotel was perfect though

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for a stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: cesl
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in this lovely hotel - as previous reviews have said it is in a great location for exploring the city and minutes away from a RER station direct from the airport. We had a triple room on the 6th floor with views of the Eiffel tower from one side and Notre Dame from the other. Like most Paris hotel rooms, it was on the small side but very clean and comfortable. Paris is an expensive city but this hotel is good value for the standard of accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect position for visiting the city”
Reviews.Author: pievik
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in very central position, 5 mm walking from Notredame church. Our room was with 3 beds, clean and comfortable. It was facing the internal courtyard, therefore it was very silent. People at reception are nice and kind. Breakfast was just too expensive, 11 euros; we preferred to refuse it and have breakfast in one of thousands "boulangerie" around there and our choice was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: SarahSouth
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located in Paris, close to transport and restaurants. The receptionist was very helpful with booking tickets and suggesting excellent restaurants. The hotel is very welcoming however as with most European hotels the rooms are a little on the small side. The room was clean and had a lovely view of the church and the Eiffel tower in the distance. Hotel has a lift and offers a decent breakfast which is convenient. When returning to Paris I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: bdhunter
Reviews.Content: Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche was our base for walking Paris for two weeks in November. This was our third visit to this charming hotel where all is spotless and the staff gives excellent service. By American standards the rooms are small, but there is good closet space, the lobby is welcoming, and it's comfortable in every way. Only steps from the Seine and Notre Dame, it's also within easy walking distance of the Marais, Place de Vosges, the Pompidou Center, and Luxembourg Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, friendly staff ina very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: gosamuel
Reviews.Content: THe hotel is nice and clean. I had a single room for one week and it was facing Notre dame, very nice view. Despite the fact the smoke smell, I was really happy with my choice. Near the Hotel there are several cafès and restaurant. I had a little problem and the staff was extremely helpful and efficient. Thank you Sabrina!

Reviews.Title: “Waste Of Money”
Reviews.Author: The_Real_B_Biddy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in hotels in many of the worlds capitals. And I must say that the Hotel Henri doesn't quite meet my expectations. The hotel was very warm & welcoming with very friendly and helpfull staff. The room was very clean and the room was cleaned every day with fresh towels provided each day. But that is where my praises end. The room was 195euros a night. The room was so small you couldn't have more than one suitcase, and were so basic I can only compare them to a Holiday Inn but to be honest even their rooms are better. There was also no breakfast provided either. Neither of these would have been a problem if we had paid 50-60euros for the night. If you stay in London, Madrid, New York or any other major cities you can get a 4-5 star hotel for less money with a fairly large room including breakfast. Not to mention the posability of facilites such as pool, gym etc........

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: carlsr
Reviews.Content: My adult daughters and I have stayed at Henri IV twice in the last two years. It is a small hotel located within walking distance of the Metro, RER, Notre Dame and many many restaurants. Tastefully decorated and easy to reach when you're coming from CDG. Moderately priced It's one of Paris' best bets if you want to be on the Left Bank. Make sure you select Henri IV Rive Gauche and check their web site. We will use it again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: secretangel
Reviews.Content: Loved the location. Rooms weren't too small by European standards and the rooms and hotel was very clean. We were two females and felt very safe in the hotel and the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, with comfort and charm”
Reviews.Author: Herring
Reviews.Content: Our room was very slightly shabby, which didn't show up in the hotel's photos, but we got used to it quiclky because it was STYLISHLY shabby - and the rest of the hotel was wonderful. Small but charming, with a pretty good breakfast. We got a 3-person room which gave the 2 of us lots of space. The bathroom was immacuclate and modern. As all others say, the location is the best, not only re walking to the sites, but close to Saite Michel Metro / train station which takes you everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, charming hotel!”
Reviews.Author: DianeUK_Shrewsbury
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at this charming hotel, great location, with lots of cheap restaurants nearby. Views of Notre Dame & Eiffel tower from our 6th floor triple room balcony. 2 minute walk to Notre. Staff are extremely helpful, booked the airport shuttle both ways with them. Air conditioning and free wi-fi worked perfectly. Room with three beds, bathroom with bath, shower , 2 sinks & hairdryer, very clean and nicely decorated. 6th floor room with great views and very quiet, no noise from traffic on busy street below. 12 euros for a buffet breakfast, cereal, bread, cold meats but if you ask the staff they will make eggs any style, they are very accomodating! Lots of bars nearby serving breakfast, similar or more expensive, wonderful bakery just behind hotel , 2 streets away, have the almond croissants!! This hotel is a little treasure and we would stay there again, it's location in the latin quarter was perfect. Well done Hotel Henri iv & thank you trip adviser for helping us find it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Place with Atmosphere and Location”
Reviews.Author: Donna1124
Reviews.Content: Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche was in an excellent location. The hotel is one block from the Siene and two blocks from Notre Dame in the Latin Quarter on rue St Jacques. The hotel faces St Severin Cathedral. It is a convenient location to restaurants and eateries. Our room on the 4th floor had a beautiful view of the cathedral through a lovely large window which we kept open. The room was small but cozy and nicely decorated It truly was a charming hotel with a helpful, friendly staff! The room was clean and the bed cozy and comfortable! The bathroom was very modern and clean as well. Top notch! Across the street you could get the "Hop on Hop Off" tour bus and get to many of the locations throughout the city. This truly was a good value hotel....I'd stay here again if I had the opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “great spot to explore paris from”
Reviews.Author: just_brisbane
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel in good location, good quality, good night sleep clean comfortable rooms

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: BayVillager
Reviews.Content: This is a small, charming hotel on the rue St. Jacques, directly across from the St. Severin Cathedral, of which our room had an imposing view. Our double room was very small, but it was simply and nicely decorated, the bed was very comfortable, and the bathroom quite up-to-date. Everything was crisp and clean. The location is terrific -- in the Latin Quarter, but so close to the Seine, it's an easy walk over the bridge to the Right Bank, and almost literally a stone's throw from Notre Dame. Before turning in on Saturday night we opened our window and just enjoyed watching the busy street scene below, and even had a glimpse of the twinkling top of the Eiffel Tower. Elevator is small, so we usually took the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “3rd time back, always a charm”
Reviews.Author: suz_c_mitchell
Reviews.Content: THE best location in Left Bank paired with such lovely, caring, attentive employees makes this an absolute must-stay spot. It's got charm, convenience, and little touches that make Paris an even more amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved staying here, will return..”
Reviews.Author: Bablador01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September last year after reviewing feedback on Trip Advisor - would be lost without this site! As this was our first time overseas we found the location of the Hotel really convenient, close to eateries, sites and the tour buses (which were a fantastic way to see Paris in a short timeframe). The room was really comfortable and clean and could not fault it really. We would be happy to stay there again. The only downside to our stay which is completely unrelated to the hotel was we had arranged for a shuttle buse to pick us up on arrival (did not eventuate) and to also take us from the hotel to the airport to fly home (again, did not turn up even though it was all prearranged and caused a great deal of stress). The hotel were helpful in the sense that they did recommend a taxi and advised us what to do so for that we were greatful for their assistance. Overall, looking forward to returning as our stay at the Henri was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: uvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely little hotel from May 27 to June 1. Ideally located, two minutes walk away from Notre Dame and about 10 minutes to the Pantheon. RER and metro stations minutes away. The triple room we stayed in was clean, spacious and had wonderfully comfortable beds. The bathroom was spotless and plenty of hot water. The staff were friendly, willing to answer all our questions and we were always greeted with a smiling bonjour. Lots of eating places nearby, especially across the road. When I return to Paris, I would love to stay here again. Its on a busy street, but we didn't find it a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A great start in Paris”
Reviews.Author: katyjoyNewZealand
Reviews.Content: We started our month long trip in Paris at this very lovely Hotel. Its very convenient if you need to be catching the train to the South of France. A short taxi ride. Our room was cosy but delightful and to open our windows and view the beautiful church across the road was special. We were on the 4th floor and i would suggest getting your room there if you can. Noise was not a problem for us and we were facing street. Rue Mouffetard market is a must on the weekend, faboulous food, music and dancing in the street. Staying at this Hotel means its also a very short walk across to the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & Parisian Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cecemac_302
Reviews.Content: Across the river from Notre Dame, this hotel is in a perfect location. The rooms are not too small (as most European room can be) - I have stayed in a double and a triple, each with enough room, clean, modern bath, closets, room fridge, yet you know you are staying in Paris, as it has a great Parisian atmosphere. Helpful staff. Continental breakfast at a small extra charge and room service. It is a gem! It is the place I stay when visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A dissenting view....”
Reviews.Author: RTL212
Reviews.Content: In fairness let me provide context for what I have to say: I've been to Paris dozens of times over several decades, for business and pleasure. I know the city well and have stayed in many arrondisements and speak the language. Given that experience I am mystified by the good reviews of this hotel. Though the personnel were very nice and the public rooms downstairs are very nice (albeit small, even for a 3 star hotel), the location is, to me, awful. I can see where people visiting PAris for a first time might be excited to step out the front door and see Notre Dame, etc. a brief walk away, the street is very very noisy, swamped with buses and cars and motorcycles and traffic of every sort, and it is loud. Very loud. Also, the Latin Quarter is extremely congested, filled with students and the cheap restaurants that serve them. It is much less attractive than the 6th, which is almost as easy a walk to the Louvre, Notre Dame, Musee d'Orsay, etc. We were lucky and had a very quiet room at the back of the hotel, but it looked onto an air shaft that, while clean, wasn't very interesting. So the choice seems to be horribly noisy rooms with view on the street, or peace and quiet with a view of an air shaft that could be in any city in any country. I think one can do better in the same arrondisement or others. Paris is a delightful city and you can walk to the same monuments from other hotels without the noise. One other important thing -- they charge something like $15-18 per person for breakfast. So if comparing price to hotels that include breakfast, you can go a good $30-40 higher and end up the same.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: WinnFamily
Reviews.Content: OK, so my husband took me to Paris for my 40th birthday. We are your average suburban couple who travels occasionally and are not high maintenance. That being said, we always seek out nice hotels that are very clean, very comfy but not pretentious. This hotel was PERFECT! I can't over emphasize the importance of location and this one couldn't be beat - you are close to a great metro stop, the river, Notre Dame, and awesome little ally ways full of good food and drinks. The bathrooms (which is always my barometer for the rest of the hotel) were modern, clean and functional. The room, although small, was very comfortable. All hotel rooms in Paris are small so this really made no difference to us. The air condition worked great, but we opened the window and enjoyed the cool air. The beds had nice linens and were not too hard. As many other reviewers have mentioned, the street noise at night can be loud, but it really didn't bother us. All in all, I would highly recommend this property. We said to ourselves over and over that we really lucked out by picking this hotel - you just never know. I can honestly say that what you see on their website is very much what you get and you won't be disappointed. Skip the hotel breakfast. There are a million bakeries and creperies on every corner. Also, they had free wifi which actually worked very well.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel to Start a Two Week European Vacation”
Reviews.Author: mzimmerman2
Reviews.Content: It's been 14 years since my last European vacation and almost 35 the last time I saw Paris. This hotel was a great spot to ease my girlfriend and I back into the pace and change of foreign travel. I prefer the smaller, quaint hotels and the Henri IV rive Gauche exceeded our expectations. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Bathrooms were updated and clean with a contemporary European design (ceramic tile and polished stone). We had an innner room off the second floor with limited natural light supplied by an inner atrium. I believe other rooms had views out to the street, but this particular room was nice and quiet. We only needed our room to keep our bags and to bathe and sleep so it was perfect for our needs and nicely decorated and of course very clean. Morning breakfast was continental with fresh croissants and other rolls; great coffee; yogurt, fruit, cold meats, cheese, cerial, juice, milk...and more. The staff was most helpful. Pre-arrival they arranged for private shuttle service pick-up at the airport (we pay the driver in cash)...there is also train/metro service within blocks of the Hotel if desired. The staff had excellent restaurant suggestions included a fantastic dinner at Le Coupe Chou a short walk from the hotel tucked away in a charming neighborhood near the Pantheon. The dinner was most memorable as was the decor of this cozy eatery. We never would have found this spot had it not been for the staff. And of course they called on our behalf and landed us reservations. This hotel is in a prime central location to anywhere you want to go in Paris. We walked everywhere, but the Metro station is a couple of blocks away for destinations a bit out of comfortable walking distance if you prefer to ride. The excitement of the night life in the Latin Quarter is nearby...take a walk and enjoy the food, beverage and people watching. Great walks along the Seine are available. Notre Dame is a few blocks away. Our stop in Paris was short but we would not hesitate to book a stay at this Hotel on a return trip. Quality staff...helpful and friendly...great accomodations and great central location. Our two weeks in Europe included Paris, Rome, Venice and Munich. We booked all hotels on line from our own web research and reviews posted on TripAdvisor. We did not have a regret in any hotels we chose in any city.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely location but VERY noisy”
Reviews.Author: Dahaab
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ideally situated as we only stayed for one weekend and wanted to see as much as possible on foot. We had great weather and everything was within walking distance including restaurants. Only regret is, that our room faced the street and it was so noisy that we barely slept. Sleeping with windows closed was not an option as it was quite warm. Rooms were small but we didn't spend much time in it so it was adequate. Breakfast was good value and basic. If we went again, we would definitely book a room out back.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: emanuele7262
Reviews.Content: I've been there on november and even if I've booked a double use single the bed wasn't european standard double bed; was a french bed (cm 140 more or less) The room was clean and very silent. Staff very friendly and very good location few step from Notre Dame

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Service, small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sal_711
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great spot, lots of wonderful cafe's and creperies nearby. The room was very small, and only a double bed which made for a poor nights sleep. The rates are the same no matter if you book in advance on Expedia etc or walk in off the street. The windows are double glazed which makes for very little noise. The hop-on-hop-off tour departs from Notre Dame, about 2 minutes walk away. Suggest booking a car transfer if arriving from the airport as the taxi's are very expensive. The return transfer organised by the hotel was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little gem in the heart of the Left Bank.”
Reviews.Author: Maggie C
Reviews.Content: The hotel was easy to find and supremely well located, especially for dining of which the neighborhood abounds. The street frontage seems like it might be noisy, but our room was on an interior airshaft/courtyard and was very, very quiet. The room was small but had plenty of storage both drawers and multiple closets. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. The staff at the desk were all very helpful, advising about good restaurants/bistros/brasseries and how to get here or there. They even helped us when there was a strike coming up to get to the train station despite the situation. I have nothing but good things to say about all the staff at the hotel. One even put up with my many questions about French keyboards and how to use them for the free internet. The only drawback was the beds were kind of old and tired and saggy. Some people have said the breakfast was a little pricy and that you could get cheaper in the neighborhood. That is true and we found more than one place to eat breakfast in. But the convenience of in the hotel has something to be said for it and the food there was good. If you want a place for a reasonable expenses in Paris (not cheap), that is centrally located for many activities, near many good places to eat, then this is a great choice. Within walking distance are the Pantheon, the Sorbonne, all the ancient parts of Paris including Notre Dame Cathedral, St Germain de Pres, St Sevran (across the street), the Cluny medieval and ancient roman Paris museum, as well as the Ile de Cite, Ste Chapelle, and the remains of Roman Paris musuem (under the plaza in front of Notre Dame). The Louvre is just across the river and a few blocks down; there are many Metro stations within a few blocks depending on where you want to go. And did I say there are hundreds of places to eat within a few blocks? Oh, yes, there are many, many good places to eat in in the neighborhood! Brasserie Balzar and Le Coup Chou to name two we liked a lot.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but area was too touristy for us. front desk staff should be aware of promises made to potential clients”
Reviews.Author: natalierue
Reviews.Content: Bring ear plugs. We enjoyed our stay (9 days) at this nice little hotel.. BUT...we were told that we could have a room in the back if our front room proved to be too noisy ..and it was. Even though the front rooms have lovely views it was terribly noisy especially in the evening due to a bar nearby and raucous young people yelling at 2:00 am...The morning traffic on rue st. jacques is similar to NY's 57th street at 8 am. Much to my dismay...we were not given a back room because there was construction and painting going on during our stay (which we were not informed of PRIOR to arrival!) We were given another front room on a lower floor. The front desk woman assured me via email that we could change to a back room but the gentleman who checked us in was adamant about it not being available. Also...advice to those who book - make sure you confirm how much your taxi's will charge you to train stations, airports etc. we were told one thing by the front desk and had much more added once in the vehicle. (i.e. if you reserve a taxi. the fare to gare du nord begins when the taxi arrives outside of the hotel door. ...not when you get in.) Lastly....on several occasions I placed a room service tag on our door indicating that we did not need our bed made or new towels and each time they went in the room despite the sign. On one occasion when they were supposed to clean the room the carpet was not vacuumed. All hotel staff were polite and helpful with directions. The plus was that we were walking distance or an easy bus ride to any museum or restaurant that we wanted to visit. I will not stay here on my next visit because it is too noisy ..too close to the quartier latin and the tourists section.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Bogeydemps
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved our stay at this hotel! We've been to Paris many times and stayed in lots of different hotels. After reading many reviews on Tripadvisor, we requested room on one of the top 3 floors and got room 501. We couldn't have been more pleased! The staff was very lovely and accommodating; upon request, they made several hard-to-get restaurant reservations for us. The hotel itself is really beautiful and ideally situated for sightseeing. Inside, it's charming and very clean. Our room had a magnificent view of St. Severin and the Eiffel Tower. Our room was in great order, and the bathrooms were spacious (for city standards) and clean. Room 501 is on the street, so we needed to close our window at night to keep out the sound. Though we didn't have breakfast at the hotel, there are many places to grab a croissant and cafe in the area before setting off for the day. We'll definitely be back! Thank you to the staff for making our stay so memorable. Pluses: charming hotel in a perfect location, good rates, nice staff, clean, free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Triple room was perfect for paris standards!”
Reviews.Author: CERAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I visited Paris with two friends and booked a triple room. The room was very spacious! There's good airco, which is nice considering the hot August nights. No real views, but that means: sleeping quite. The hotel itself is cute with romantic decorations and a good location: within walking distance from both St Germain and the Marais. Be warned that there are several hotels with the same name! So make sure you book the right one.

Reviews.Title: “Charming choice when no construction”
Reviews.Author: VangrooverKits
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel at least three times. It is a charming boutique hotel with elevator, friendly staff, and spectacular views of the St. Severin chuch (and Eiffel Tower if on a high floor). The location is very good - next to the Latin District but just out of the noisy bit, walk across a bridge to Notre Dame, St. Michel Metro/RER B nearby so direct route from CDG airport or Gare du Nord (Eurostar). The latest trip we left early due to construction noise and chaos (I understand the work is now complete), but also difficulty with wi fi in the room (6th floor), three single, soft beds in a triple room (not ideal for a family) and uncertainty around effectiveness of the air conditioner. We may come back in future trips if there is no construction, but we did find a higher rated, more modern hotel for the same price including breakfast at the last minute so it may not be the best value.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back if I was being paid”
Reviews.Author: Roxton
Reviews.Content: I had to search long and hard on Trip Adviser before I realised they were talking about the hotel we stayed at. Our room was small, cramped and smelt of old fabric, we had a window but it looked out to some kind of shaft so it didn't matter what time of day it was, you had to have the lights on. The bed was hard and small. There was a mini bar but no price list and no way of making tea or coffee. The bathroom was damp and infested with silver fish - it looked like it would benefit from a good clean. Towels weren't changed daily even if you did what you do in other hotels - they're just put back on the heated towel rail. For the Brits amongst you, the area is like staying in old style Southend without the Sea, or maybe the back end of Soho. Its expensive and so touristy they can't wait to relieve you of your Euros for some pretty poor food and wine. However it is central and easy to get anywhere else by Metro - the only good point of this hotel. We were told it has been refurbished, this was overly optimistic - They were still painting and decorating to the extent that the stairs were covered in slippery plastic dust sheets and the hand rail was covered up to protect it from the paint. The shaft outside of our 'window' housed scaffolding which makes a distinctive clinking sound when it rains. This isn't good value - it maybe cheap and if that's what you want then fine. But just be clear what you're getting and don't believe the pictures on the hotel web site - they are using some good lighting and artistic licence!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: QUaGi
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights during August and purchased booked a late minute deal online the day before arrival. No problems checking in whatsoever, staff friendly and able to speak english, room facing main street with balcony (refer room # 401 - great double size room), and the common areas of the hotel very clean and presentable. PROS: 1. Whilst our room was facing the very busy main street, next to no noise could be heard through the double glazed doors when closed. Walls are also double bricked and cement rendered, meaning no noise from the neighbouring rooms. 2. Air conditioning working perfectly and able to cool room during peak summer period. 3. Bed extremely comfortable and clean. 4. Hotel was at final staged of completing their refurbishment during time of our stay, but even so, minimal impact on presentation and/or comfort. 5. Friendly staff at reception, as well as hotel staff very friendly and always smiling. 6. Fantastic central and convenient location in south bank. 7. Free wifi internet as part of room rate. Very fast and secure wifi connection from your room at no additional fee. CONS: 1. Hotel breakfast was as you would expect from most hotels in this price range and fairly bland/average. But this is an option and not included in price of room. 2. Whilst hotel location is close to some major tourist attractions and a Metro line, expect to come across large crowds in the surrounding streets. We found getting to and from the metro slightly painful during busy periods (after 11am to 9pm) because of the hordes of tourists in the side streets leading directly to closest Metro. Overall, would not hesitate recommending this hotel to anyone. No major complaints and nothing but praise to give.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: sas526
Reviews.Content: Just got home last night. All the other reviews state the facts - great views, amazing location (literally steps to Notre Dame and RER B) and many sites are walkable. Staff absolutely lovely to us - extra towels, pillows, let me stay a bit later in the room than checkout, arranged shuttle to airport, etc. Can't imagine staying anywhere else in Paris now. Would miss having St. Sev as my neighbor:)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: a1306m
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor recommendations - and we were very pleased. As many people suggested, we requested a room at the back to avoid street noise. When we arrived, the lady at the desk had a room at the back available for us, but also gave us an additional key to a room at the front (with a spectacular view of the church across the street), and let us go up and pick which room we liked better. We chose the room at the front with the view - and didn't have any issues with the noise. We found the room to be very comfortable, clean and decorated nicely. Those at the desk were friendly and helpful. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Access and Charm”
Reviews.Author: HartfordFamilyTravel
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel and great location. Easy access to major sites (Louve, hop on/hop off bus, Notre Dame, markets, metro). We had two rooms which were spotless, front desk was very helpful (they held our luggage as we arrived before check in from the Eurostar from London) and provided us with adapters and irons with little wait. Free wifi is terrific. Shower/baths with removable sprays that make it easy to clean up tired children at the end of the day. We did not eat at the hotel, grabbed breakfast at one of the many cafes in the area on the way. Thanks for all the previous reviews - I would never have found it without TA and would have ended up in a charmless major chain hotel otherwise!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beginning for our European Vacation”
Reviews.Author: isabill
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel per TA recommendations and were not disappointed. We arrived in Paris about 6 am and took a cab to the hotel to drop off our luggage (understandably, the room wasn't ready) to a very nice front desk staff. The hotel doesn't look like much from the street (as confirmed by the facial expression of our teenager!) but it is very charming inside. It is just around the block from Notre Dame so we busied ourselves with sightseeing until we could check in. There are several pedestrian streets nearby as well for window shopping and restaurants. The views from the three person room we stayed in are AMAZING! A view of Notre Dame from one small terrace and Saint Severin, Eiffel Tower from the front balcony. The beds were comfy, had nice sheets and the bathroom (double sink) was perfect for us. The AC worked well and the room was very quiet at night, perfect to catch up on sleep after being awake for almost 24 hours. The staff is quite nice here and very helpful. WHEN we return to Paris, we will book this hotel again. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Quiet Hotel, Great Location - No frills, great value!”
Reviews.Author: MichelleD_31
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for the value and location and that's exactly what I got. The entry is lovely and the guest lobby is very cozy and welcoming. Our room was on the top floor (per my request based upon TripAdvisor reviews) and overlooked the church across the street. We had a huge window that could open to the street scene below, which was nice. The rooms were clean and had everything you could need - king bed, desk, flat screen TV, 2 small closets, fridge, separate entry way where we could leave our jackets, shoes and day-packs - a nice touch given the room is on the small side, which is typical in Europe. The bathroom was clean, had ample toiletries, hairdryer, etc. Staff was friendly and helpful and the housekeeping was great. I found this hotel to be nice and quiet - and you can't beat the location in the Latin Quarter (right there but not quite in the middle of it all). I loved the location as you could walk everywhere! Literally a half block from Notre Dame, a few blocks from Luxembourg Gardens, and so on... There are some nice touches like fruit in the lobby and ample umbrellas for guests to stay dry on those rainy Paris days. If you are looking for value, cleanliness, location and quiet - but don't want to sacrifice location and convenience, I'd highly recommend this hotel. I plan to come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Big room for little price”
Reviews.Author: crazyjaney9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a 3 nights stay in June. Wonderful location and large room for Paris. Two Closets and nice size bathroom. Internet very slow is my only complaint. Very close to Metro. Lots of good places to eat. Located between the river and San Germain. Close to Notre Dame. Recommend this hotel fi you are looking to stay on the Left Bank.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a Paris Holiday”
Reviews.Author: amysuet
Reviews.Content: This hotel located on Rue Saint Jacques was a perfect location for a recent holiday to Paris. The taxi driver did not know where it was despite the name and address I gave him. I showed him the spot on my itouch map and he was able to find it. It is located on the fringe of the tourist area near Notre Dame. It is within walking distance to Notre Dame and all that the islands hold. The only ATM we found nearby was on Ile de Cite. The hotel is very clean with English speaking desk attendants who were pleasant and friendly throughout our stay. Our rooms were Paris sized, but plenty comfortable to move around. There are two closets, one for hanging clothes and the perfect size to stash our 25" suitcases and one with very deep shelves and a safe that came in handy. The A/C worked very well and maybe even too well. Apparently the compressor produced a lot of condensation while we were there and the hotel was at full compacity. We had a terrible leak from the ceiling in the bathroom one evening. It was attended to promptly and we were give a lot of extra towels to soak up water. It was late when it started so someone had to come in the morning to figure out the problem. The hotel was also full so we couldn't be moved. the problem was attended to while we were out the next morning and the leaking was stopped. There is plenty of hot water despite a full hotel and the FREE wireless internet worked great in our room. We had a view of the back of the hotel and not the street. It was very very quiet at night. My companions had the street side on the 3rd floor and said it was like Mardi Gras in New Orleans at 3 in the morning despite the glazing on the windows. Metro stations are close by enabling easy transit to sites. Lots of places to eat nearby too. We did not eat the breakfast buffet due to the cost and just grabbed a pastry and coffee nearby as we walked to the metro in the mornings. I will definately consider this hotel again on a return trip

Reviews.Title: “Central”
Reviews.Author: commanderbyrne
Reviews.Content: Central location with friendly staff. Rooms were fairly standard for a European city. Plenty of books downstairs to have a look at while waiting for a taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Good Quality for Price!”
Reviews.Author: がゆこ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family and this is a great 3 star hotel with good quality for the price we are paying. It is in a very convenient location but most of the rooms are very calm as they face the other side of the street. There is a free internet place with a computer in the basement. I have to say the twin / double room for 2 people are very tiny. Triple room is much bigger and probably the best room - there is not much price difference so I recommend the triple room even if you are two.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Friendly”
Reviews.Author: JamJarLondon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the this hotel during the recent Easter Bank Holiday weekend. We decided to drive to Paris from the UK and enquired with the hotel any local parking places and the costs. They replied to our query within 2 minutes with full details of local parking amenities. When we arrived at the hotel Saturday afternoon and we were given a map and helpful information on all the main tourist attractions. The rooms are adequately sized, clean and very comfortable. We were on the first floor and though the traffic was noisy by 8-9 am this actually served a great natural alarm clock. We didn't have breakfast in the hotel but opted to use the many cafes in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, location and service. Road noise and small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Beltway_Hater
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms at this very small, crisply managed hotel. The larger room bordered the main road and we had a few nights with much noise. Our second room was tiny. It scarcely had room for two single beds and our luggage. On the plus, it faced towards the inner courtyard and was dead quite. Overall, for the value and being right in the heart of the Latin Quarter and next to Notre Dame, well worth a couple hours of sirens and singing drunks.

Reviews.Title: “Everything We Wanted”
Reviews.Author: LetsTravelNow10
Reviews.Content: We used Trip Advisor to find the Henri IV: we were very pleased and would highly recommend it to others. The location can't be beat: in the 5th and only a few streets from the river and the St Michael Metro stop and the RER line. The henri IV is small with a homey feel: more like staying in a B&B than a hotel. The room (#401) was small but looked over the church across the street: who wouldn't want that view every morning! Natalie and Sabrina at the front desk were helpful with reservations and other suggestions. The noise from rue St Jacques can be a bit much and the neighborhood is party-central on the weekend. Otherwise, it's a jewel of a hotel in a marvelous location. (PS: run away from the restaurants in the neighborhood: they're all about as authentic French as my accent)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in the perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Brooksie75
Reviews.Content: I very carefully researched Paris hotels to stay in with my two friends for the first few days of our French adventure in March. Not only did I get a great deal on a 3 bed room at Henri IV, but the location was unbeatable! We were able to walk to all of the sites in Paris or hop on the Metro with no problem. Notre Dame was literally around the corner, there were a ton of fun shops and restaurants immediately outside the front door of the hotel, and the awesome Gothic church outside our window was an amazing sight to wake up to.

Reviews.Title: “as nice as expected!”
Reviews.Author: ukvisitor63
Reviews.Content: Thanks to previous visitors` suggestion, we chose to stay there. It is a cosi place, near the city center, near to RER Trains stop (for those who travels from Orly is fantastic!!) and Metro Station. Notre dame is 2 minutes walking time from hotel, Louvre 15 min. Big choice of Restourants nearby, but do pay attention if you look for breakfast bar. They will charge you 6.50 € a cappuccino and 4 euros a croissant if you choose the "wrong" one!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel for singles or couples”
Reviews.Author: IsisInParis
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from staying at this hotel and I enjoyed my stay there. I stayed 3 nights on my own and 3 nights in a different room with my husband. My first room was a single at the back of the hotel, there is a small entrance with a built-in wardrobe, a small space with a single bed, a couple of steps up to another space with desk/dressing table and a shower room beyond that. You can step outside the window onto a tiled sitting area, no view as such apart from the backs of buildings and chimney pots, (but beware as the door cannot be opened from the outside so dont let it slam closed!) but it was nice out there with plant pots and trellis and the air. It was a very peaceful retreat from the busy street outside and I enjoyed my time there. The double room I had with my husband was on the 2nd floor on the front of the hotel overlooking the Church. Both rooms were nicley furnished, double room had a mini-bar and a bath with shower over, plenty of storage, lovely and clean with crisp white bed linen and good quilts. We didnt have breakfast there but be warned - 12 Euros for breakfast isnt as expensive as it sounds! The downstairs areas were lovely, interesting with books and magazines, lovely sofas and chairs and plants and pictures, internet in the basement. Staff were professional and courteous rather than outgoing but all very helpful, they helped me with finding an address in Paris and got me a google map. I was shown to my room and helped upstairs in the lift with my luggage which was nice for me on my own after a long journey. Location was brilliant, 2 minutes to Notre Dame, similar to Metro stations and the RER to Charles De Gaulle Airport, over the road a maze of cheaper restaurants, I ate there in Moroccan and French restaurants and had amazing food very cheaply, in fact the best tagine I have ever had. There are also more expensive restaurants in the area where we ate too, good French cuisine. The area is very safe for a woman alone, I walked all over at night. I nearly booked a hotel near Sacre Couer but was glad I didn't, we went up there in the daytime and I didnt like that area as much and didn't feel safe. It is true to say the front room wasn't exactly quiet, it was winter when we stayed so we had the windows closed and it didnt bother us one bit but if you stay in summer and are light sleepers you may be better off asking for a room at the back or sides. But we had the view......you cant have everything; centre of Paris, view and silence at night! It wouldnt put me off staying there again. As for the people who say the rooms are too small, well I didnt think so. My single room was cosy but perfectly adequate and well designed, our double room was plenty big enough for the two of us. Bathrooms were compact but big enough and very clean. I think the people who complain about the rooms being small dont realise the cost of property in the centre of Paris, or should consider staying at a much more expensive hotel. I hope one day I will be lucky enough to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay her again!”
Reviews.Author: CLAnj
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to everything! In walking distance to nearly everything or a short metro trip away. Staff was wonderful. Room was ready and kept clean.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Marie-NYNY
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in a great location, blocks away from the Seine and Notre Dame. Had a single room - room was internal and though small, had enough room for my suitcase and also to move around. Bathroom was small but new with a very good shower. Finally, reception desk was cordial and helpful - friends who met me at the hotel complimented how they were treated by the reception desk when they stopped by.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: rochenko
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights here on the basis of Tripadvisor recommendations, and were not disappointed. We had to change the date of our stay for family-related reasons twice, and the staff could not have been more helpful, ensuring that (as the trip was for our wedding anniversary) we had, as requested, a room at the front of the hotel overlooking the Eglise St-Severin on the 5th floor (502), and that champagne was waiting for us when we arrived (for an extra charge). Views from the room across the 5e and 6e arondissements towards the Eiffel tower were stunning, and with the windows closed the room was extremely quiet, despite the rue St Jacques being a busy thoroughfare. The weather was very warm for late September, but the air conditioning efficient. The room was small but comfortable, very clean; breakfast not great value but adequate. As far as the hotel itself goes, two factors make Henri IV outstanding in our book: first (as lots of reviewers have pointed out) the location is unbeatable. Second, the staff are marvellous - couldn't have been more helpful in providing information, reserving tables at nearby restaurants, and so on. We'd go back without hesitation (but would definitely try our best to get a similar room).

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: GAFAD
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel has to be the best-located hotel in Paris. 100m to Notre Dame, opposite St Severin & the latin quarter. Very close to so many great restaurants & cafes & public transport options. The rooms are very small but pretty & extremely comfortable & with excellent bathroom, although it was small too. The room we had was on the 3rd floor at the front with a great view of the street - with this came street noise while you had the 2 windows open, not so much a problem when closed. The guest lounge was very comfortable. Staff are friendly & very accommodating. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, with so many cafes closeby, why would you? If we are ever back in Paris we would choose to stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great location - grat hotel”
Reviews.Author: manada
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed here 5 times on our way through to Provence, having tried a number of other small hotels in the area. We keep coming back. The rooms are small but freshly renovated (my guess is about 5-6 years ago). Ask for one at the back as the street is busy - but Paris hotel rooms, unless you pay big bucks, are small as many of the buildings are 19th century. We did find that sometimes the "double bed" we asked for was 2 beds pushed together. The hotel has a fantastic location, though, within walking distance of Notre Dame, Ile de la Cite, the Pompidou, the Louvre, the Musee D'Orsay. The staff can be snippy at times - they are not set up to give tourist advice but who can't get that on the internet anyway? Do your research ahead of time. The restaurants they have recommended have all been great and within walking distance. The breakfasts are generous, with lots of choice for this price range. So, having tried a few other hotels in this area, and price range, notably on Ile de la Cite, we still keep coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Location Great, Disappointing with everything else..”
Reviews.Author: CreateSF
Reviews.Content: My partner and I arrived here on a Monday morning, having made reservations in May. Before arriving, we had noticed that the hotel was offering special deals. We had written asking for our reservations to be upgraded as the difference in what we had reserved and what they were now offering for the same room was SIGNIFICANT, i.e. 60 euros/night, and we were staying 6 nights. Needless to say, no one answered our email, so, when we arrived, I asked again and was told that there was really nothing that they could do. I asked then if they could at least throw in breakfast every day, at no charge, since it's buffet style. They refused. They were nice, but absolutely zero willingness to work with us. On top of now realizing that we're paying full price for our room, we're given a room on a lower floor (3) on the street side. And, the room is small, small, small...bording on tiny. The bathroom is even smaller...you can barely move around. I won't even go into the fact that the minibar barely works, so if you put something cold in, within hours, it's lukewarm. Also, they clearly do not change the sheets each day. And, no body lotion, just basic soap and shampoo...no conditioner. And, THEY DO NOT CHANGE THE SHEETS DAILY!!!! Be aware. And the staff, really worthless. They're curteous, but will not lift a finger to help you, but they'll small the entire time they're telling you that they're not helping you. As I already said, they wouldn't help with trying either trying to upgrade our room, lower the rate or include breakfast. Then, the next day, when we had asked how the rental bikes in town work, the woman behind the counter said she had no idea and that we should ask at the Tabac! That completely surprised me. This is a hotel with people coming to visit your city, how could you not be informed about something so significant (they're literally every 370 meters) as bike rentals? Especially since they're pushing every kind of propaganda in their lobby for all the expensive tourist items. The last straw was today, when we asked if we could get a wake up call for tomorrow as we needed to leave for the train station early AND THERE IS NO CLOCK (alarm or otherwise) in the room. The guy behind the counter said that he wasn't the one who'd be here for the night shift, so that we should come back later tonight and ask that person! I was like, 'could you maybe leave a note for the person you're changing shifts with?' He reluctantly agreed. But it was really irritating, zero customer service, they're more like a lifeless/brainless body behind a counter, taking keys and giving keys (yes, you cannot take your room keys with you and you only get one). Bottom line, the location is great, but literally everything about the hotel is a huge disappointment. We have both been to Paris many times, and I lived here in the early 80's and come back frequently. French is not a problem for us. We really just wanted to try a different hotel. We're thinking that the hotel is really used to dealing with people who are new to Paris, willing to pay for a lot of unnecessary things, and accept whatever they're told I can think of many other hotels, in this price range ($189 euros/night), that are much, much better.

Reviews.Title: “Location superb”
Reviews.Author: Honey46
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here during the recent heat wave. so the air con was tested and worked really well! We had a quiet room at the back of the hotel, which although smallish, was perfectly big enough for the two of us (both nearly 6' tall). The room was just lovely, the fabrics were pretty, the furniture, tastefull and all looked recently decorated. The beds were really comfortable and both the bedroom and bathroom very clean. All of the staff were both helpful and friendly. We passed on the breakfast ; the local boulangerie was only a minutes walk away, so picnicked on the square in the shady cool of Notre Dam, which was just 2 minutes walk away. At 8.30 a.m there were only a few tourists about and it was heavenly! We had travelled over on the Eurostar, our first experience and it was excellent, plus an easy transfer on the RER b, just 3 stops from the Gare du Nord to the nearest stop to the hotel - St Michel. We found the hotel quickly and easily, located opposite the St Savarin church, Rue St Jaques runs on from Rue Petit Pont (opposite Notre Dam) after approx one hundred metres, so look for that first. Our first stay in the Latin Quarter; its lively, with lots of resturants, but still had the feeling the locals were eating here too, we found a couple of tiny supermarkets for water, juice and fruit, plus a good boulangerie too. Despite the heatwave, there was so much to see within easy walking distance. The metro is quick and easy to navigate, but not so much fun when its that hot. Along with all of the usual hot spots to visit, one of our favourite quirky places was The Shakespeare Bookshop, just around the corner. Most of the galleries and museums also offer free entry to under 26's from the European Union, plus the hotel was affordable, so although Paris is definatley expensive, this visit did not break the bank.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with nice but tiny rooms...”
Reviews.Author: LizSTL
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers stated, you can't beat the location. The area is always bustling, plenty of restaurants/cafes right at your door, and everything is withing walking distance (steps from Notre Dame). Room was tiny but the bathroom was clean and updated. We also found 2 great restaurants just a few blocks down by the Sorbonne...Le Petit Prince and Le Coupe Chou. Must try! All in all it was a wonderful hotel for the price and we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, clean and affordable”
Reviews.Author: Maxwell03
Reviews.Content: Small, small rooms but we were prepared for this. Tiny but totally updated bath. GREAT LOCATION one block off river on Rue St. Jaques. Two blocks from Notre Dame and right across street from St. Severin (my favorite church in Europe) and the Latin Quarter. One fussy night manager but became friendly if you ignored him. Decent service. Clean room with two twin beds pushed together. Would have made a darling dorm room in college. About 200.00 dollars a night. Worth the price and definitely a great location.

Reviews.Title: “A reasonable 3 Star Parisien Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WisteriaView
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in June 09 with our two year old. We travelled by Eurostar into Gare du Nord. Finding the right RER platform was NOT EASY. After reading other Tripadvisor reviews I knew to look for RER-B to St Michel, but the menagerie of maps, signs, letters, and numbers at Gare du Nord is very confusing. We were loaded down with heavy luggage, toddler and buggy, and trying to negotiate steps, escalators, lifts etc was a nightmare. On our return journey the lovely hotel Receptionist booked us a taxi, that turned up 5 mins later, and took 20 mins to get to the station – for 16 Euros – much easier and much less stressful! Before leaving the UK, I had scoped out the hotel and local streets using Google Maps ‘Streetview’, so we knew exactly where to go after leaving St Michel RER station. The streets around here are narrow, cobbled and like a spider’s web, so having some idea of the geography prior to our arrival turned out to be very useful. The hotel is pretty and elegant, a quaint, tall and narrow Parisien building. Reception staff were excellent and spoke very good English. There is free WiFi in all rooms, and a computer in the basement with free internet. Breakfast at 12 Euros each is not too bad value, there are slightly cheaper places nearby. However, contrary to a recent review, the hotel breakfast quality is very good and the choice is probably better than nearby restaurants: yoghurts, cheeses, cooked meats, Kellogg’s cornflakes, tea (good tea too!), coffee, orange juice, toast, hard-boiled eggs, and a basket of fresh baguettes, croissants and pain au chocolat. However, it is true that there are patisseries nearby where you can buy a large fresh croissant for just one Euro. We had room 304, at the back of the hotel, a triple. Due to the lack of a double bed, this room would be no use to honeymooners! The AC worked OK, but then it wasn’t hot during our stay. Our daughter’s cot was squeezed between the window and our beds, making access to the wardrobe/window difficult. The decor I would describe as shabby chic, it was tired in places: ripped carpet, faulty TV remote, and quirky showerhead that liked to move out of the way and spray the walls instead! It was reasonably clean, but not thoroughly clean (hair in plughole, on bathroom floor etc). The bathroom was very small, care needed to be taken when stepping from bath/shower, anyone hung-over, half-asleep, or like me, myopic, could easily find themselves with one foot in the loo! My main concern with this hotel, and as a Mother, was that the fire escape runs through the rooms at the back of the hotel (including ours), and the door leading to it from our room was bolted/locked on both sides. Meaning, if there was a fire, the main staircase is the only route out in a six/seven storey building. There was no smoke detector in our room either (it was out on the landing). We paid nearly 900 Euros for 4 nights and 3 breakfasts, and at current exchange rates, this is the best part of a thousand pounds. For £200/night in other parts of the world you could probably find 5* luxury, but this is Paris, and the hotel’s location, staff, and general ambience is good, as others have said. However, because of the fire safety issue, I wouldn’t stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: karen2020
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights here. Very clean, quiet room 404 at rear of hotel. Easy to metro and ND. It was cold and rainy so I can't comment on AC. Most of the staff were great but one woman seemed a bit put out the couple of times we asked for something. They didn't mind booking dinner reservations for us, but when I asked about concerts I couldn't get any info, and was told to go to a FNAC (ticket seller). overall I could recommend this hotel, but I feel like it was just average...

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location with loveley helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: DMNFFC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is within 2 to 3 minutes walk of Notre Dam in the latin quarter. The location is fantastic within a few minutes walk to numerous restaurants and bars and within a 5 minute walk from Sait Michael metro and RER station. The close proximitay to the station means that the transfer from the airport couldnt be simpler with the RER B stopping here and linking directly to Charles De Gaulle. Our room in the hotel was very spacious especially by Paris standards, even with the cot set up for our baby, with a huge modern bathroom. The hotel was extrmeley clean and with the room serviced on a daily basis. The hotel does have a lift which in our case was very welcome as we had our pushchair with us. We didnt try the breakfast as we knew there were many places around the hote lto eat and we like to try different places.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to find on the street map!”
Reviews.Author: Jasmine_n_Dan
Reviews.Content: We came out from St-Michel Notre Dame station, and ended up spending about 45mins trying to locate the hotel. The nearby map on the street wasn't helpful at all, and though I rang the hotel to ask them the best directions, they didn't speak very much English, and I not a lot of French! Eventually we found it! The staff were very nice and courteous. The rooms were slightly small but typically French, which was really nice. Nice view out our window of the street and St Severin. Location-wise, it was very convenient as the local station (mentioned above) is like the London Tube, where you can change lines etc as you need to get to where you want. We weren't far by train to all the tourist sites, and in fact Notre Dame was only about a 10min walk away. Plenty plenty plenty of eating places around the hotel, a maze of streets that were nice to walk around in the summer weather. Quite a few souvenir shops too. One thing to note is that the breakfast is definately not worth paying for/booking in advance. It was a mini croissant and drink and very overpriced. Whereas there are so many cafes etc, where you could get cheaper food with more variety. Plus, if you are wanting this in a hotel, there is free internet downstairs. Oh, and there's lifts too (something you can't always assume).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Parak33t
Reviews.Content: Clean rooms with comfortable beds, Hair dryer in bathroom, One computer in lower level with Wi-Fi in rooms, Helpful reception desk, Very good location with short distance to the Metro. We've lived in Paris for four years, so we know the city very well. This is a fabulous hotel, nothing fancy but very quaint. For the price, location and accomodation of three people, we feel that it is a perfect hotel for a vacation in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Henri IV Rive Gauche Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hanapepe
Reviews.Content: Recently this month spent three nights at the Henri IV Rive Gauche in Paris. The hotel was okey, but nothing special. Paid the rack rate and found out that the rate dropped 50 euros on check out. Complained that the AC in the room didn't work and nothing was done. Had to keep window open resulting in much road noise. Fixtures and furniture was quite old. Hotel well situated near ND Cathederal and Cluny Museum. Most of the resturants nearby were of the tourist types. Paris is still wonderful in April. One museum that we recommend is Musee Branly. Archetecture and exhibits were amazing. On the RER yellow line. Train and buses made easy travel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: MellanzaneMadman
Reviews.Content: We really loved staying at this hotel. The location is fantastic, just a couple minutes walk from Notre Dame, right in the Latin Quarter. It is very easy to get to this hotel from the airport. If you take the RER-B train from the airport, there are two stops both within a 5 minute walk of the hotel. The room was small, but spacious enough for 2 people. The hotel is located on a pretty busy street, and our room was only on the second floor facing the street, but the windows did a pretty good job of keeping noise out. The room was nice and clean - although if you are 6 feet tall or more, you may have some issues. The shower is a little small, and your feet may hang off the bed. Didn't really bother me too much. The people who work at the hotel were very helpful (making reservations for us at a restaurant and being generally nice). There is also free internet access as well. Overall, a great experience. I will stay there again next time I am in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charming small hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: CMHDublin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel during a girls (well that might be a tiny bit euphemistic!) trip to Paris and it was absolutely perfect for our needs. The rooms are not huge, but very tastefully decorated with comfortable beds and fresh linens, it feels very much like a boutique hotel. The triple is cutely laid out, but in both triples and twins the twin beds are v close together - we didn't mind a bit as well used to sharing. The lobby and seating area are lovely, with comfy sofas and lots of individual touches. Staff charming and recommended excellent, non touristy restaurants. Location is fabulous, just on the edge of the over touristy Latin quarter, but one step removed, close to the river and Notre Dame, walking distance to the Marais, the Pantheon, and many other sites. And if you love browsing in bookshops, Shakespeare and co. is just around the corner. After my girlfriends left, my boyfriend joined me for a final night and we had a very romantic room on the top floor with a little gable window overlooking San Severin, so great for a romantic trip too. The only thing we would have liked if the hotel had a small bar, so we could have taken more advantage of the lovely downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I've stayed in in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Suitcase_Packer
Reviews.Content: Visited Paris four times now and this is the best hotel I have stayed in, in terms of value, service and especially location. Rooms are modern and I would say a reasonable size by Parisian standards. Bathroom was very small - but adequate - with a powerful hot shower. Service was excellent in this small hotel. Breakfast was not included in the room but can be purchased at an extra charge of €12 each per breakfast - which is not cheap, but it is good quality. We usually ate breakfast out as most of the nearby cafe's offer breakfast offers - shop around and move away from the touristy streets next to the Seine for the best deals. There are so many restaurants nearby (within 2-3 mins walk) you are spolt for choice. Most offering fixed menu deals for €10 or €15 per head for 3 courses. All the food we had locally was of a good standard - no complaints. We found coffee, beer, wine and generally all drinks very expensive across Paris - but if you do like a big cup of tea try the Starbucks on Rue Saint Michel close to the hotel. Tea and coffee are not provided in the room but there was a mini bar. For sight seeing the hotel is perfectly placed. Notre Dame and the Seine are 2-3 mins away. Centre Pompidou, musee de louvre, musee d'orsay, Jardin de Luxembourg, etc. are all within about 20 minutes walk away. For anywhere else there are several Metro stops loacted near the hotel - all within about 5 mins walk - including the RER B line which comes direct from Charles De Gaule airport and Gare de Nord station. Overall, a recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view and extremely friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: pptpia
Reviews.Content: I had to stay one night in Paris for a business trip and the Henry was just about perfect. I got a room (602) with a wonderful view of St. Severin chapel and I could even see the Eiffel tower! The room was bigger than your average Paris hotel, and it looked like it had been recently updated. The room included a good sized closet, a digital safe (broken, but promptly fixed by the hotel's staff), and the bathroom was fairly modern and very clean. Although the room faced the street, the room's soundproofing was outstanding. To my surprise, they even had free wireless internet which is very rare to find in Paris! People at the reception were extremely nice and willing to help you find a good restaurant in the neighborhood. I have been in several 3-stars hotels in Paris and this is by far the nicest property! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: VERY_Picky_Person
Reviews.Content: No better place to get the feel of Paris. Our room was a triple and much larger than expected, with closet space and a small balcony to the courtyard. The staff was always friendly and helpful. The real key to the Henri IV is Location Location Location. We felt very safe all around our hotel and just wandered up and down streets. A very lively area at night with many resturants and interesting people. There is a Monoprix store a short walk away where you can get groceries or drinks for the room. Mc Donald's and Subway are right around the corner, along with great book stores, cafes and shops. Just a block to Notre Dame, the river and the best metro area for quick access to all of Paris. I would return here in a heart beat. The Louvre is within walking distance, Eiffel, Arc, everything else is 5-15 away by metro and if you are coming or going through London the RER takes you straight to the Eurostar (10 min) Room was quiet and away from the street!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: seven3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Henri IV Rive Gauche back in May 2008 as part of our honeymoon. Pros: - Decent location that's close to restaurants and cafes - Easy to find and walking distance to the subway - Decent, bright, clean room Cons: - None really Hotels in Paris are generally pricey (from a Canadian's perspective). As mentioned by others, don't go for the breakfast; there are several cafes very close by where you can eat for a few euros.

Reviews.Title: “Again any time”
Reviews.Author: German_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We booked 2 rooms, one double for my husband and I, and one triple for our kids and aupair, for a weekend Mid-November. We booked this hotel based on the reviews here and the very good value for money. And we weren't dissapointed. I loved the style of the hotel (shown well on the website), the green/grey/beige colour scheme was kept up throughout and I enjoyed the not-too-modern interpretation of the French style (think wood panelling, striped materials, large glass-topped tables displaying high-class magazines). The double room wasn't huge, but big enough, but the triple really was great. I'd recommend going for the triple even if travelling in a party of 2, as it's worth the additional cost and the room simply feels more spacious. When the 3rd bed isn't in use as such, it is set up as a couch in a niche by the door, a couple of steps up to the main room. We were on the 4th floor, so I can only speak for these rooms, but they had lots of storage space with clever mirrored panelling on the closets to enhance the spacious feeling. There are only 4-5 rooms per floor and the doors close solidly, so we never once noticed any noise from the hallway. Same goes for outside - even though our windows faced the courtyard, it was absolutely quiet. I also appreciated the good lift . Many hotels this size have a (in my eyes) dodgey lifts, this one was absolutely fine. We went for breakfast which was ok for the price, although it was a shame there was no real French cheese, just one cheap, sliced type. The only negative I noticed was an odd smell. I never got round to asking about it, and it might well have been from the drainage works going on outside, but there was a slightly nasty (sewage?) smell in the public areas. But not in the rooms, so it wasn't really an issue or a reason not to give 5 stars. I would absolutely go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Egbert_B
Reviews.Content: I've no reason to contradict any of the many favourable reviews of this hotel already posted. Its position on the Rue Saint-Jacques is great, very close to the RER and a direct 40 minute trip to CDG airport, within a gentle amble of Notre Dame and the river. Our room, on the first floor (2nd if you are American) overlooked the street and the fine chapel opposite. Despite being so close to the street the noise was amazingly low; not sure what they do with double glazing in Paris, but it's astonishingly effective. There is still some noise leakage if there's someone very loud about in the dead of night, but traffic noise is just about entirely eliminated. The room was really quite a decent size for Paris, where hotels can be very cramped. The bathroom was small but entirely acceptable. Decor standards and cleanliness were excellent, the bed was comfortable, and all the usual facilities were in place and working. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, as in general it tends to be cheaper and better at any number of local bars and restaurants rather than in hotels. Reception staff were efficient and helpful when required. I will quite happily stay here again any time. Overall an outstanding combination of price, comfort and great position.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel, best location”
Reviews.Author: landlbunch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for four nights. There couldn't be a nicer hotel in Paris for the money. We stayed in a triple room because our college age daughter was with us and it was almost as if she had her own separate room. The third bed was in a little alcove as you came in your room and then you went up two steps to the main bedroom. The room was beautiful and a good size. The bathroom very nice. Everything was very clean. There were even 3 closets in our room. The breakfast even at 12 euros is one of the best deals in town. Close to Notre Dame, St. Michel metro stop, and many restaurants. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carolin L
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at this hotel in Sept. -and Oct. 08. The staff was helpfull overall (a few did not have much personality to speak of) and most spoke enough English to be very helpful to us. The rooms are fresh and quaint, although very small. The location was very good for touring, the hotel is close to most major sights (the river, Notre Dame, Louvre) and we walked everywhere - including to the Eiffel Tower (which we had a view of from our hotel window!). The location was also excellent for seeking restaurants, which were plentiful, although the Latin Quarter can be a bit noisy on weekends. On our last night, our air conditioning quit working and we were forced to sleep with the window open onto the Latin Quarter on a Friday night before our flight back to Canada. We did not get any sleep. I would happily stay at this hotel again or recommend it as good value to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Paris Lodging”
Reviews.Author: bdjohnson
Reviews.Content: If you wish to genuinely feel like you are experiencing Paris, then stay at this hotel. A perfectly charming property with an engaging, professional staff. The location speaks for itself as you can hear, see and feel the pulse of this great city. We were fortunate to stay in room 401 with a small balcony and wonderful view. The Henri IV is non-smoking, has an elevator and is conveniently nestled between the St. Michel and Cluny metros. Yes, there is considerable street-life noise if you choose to open the balcony doors but very quiet when they are closed. The room had a desk, safe, mini-bar, two closets, decent-sized bathroom and comfortable bed. We would return in a New York minute.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique-ish Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OsmanRandhawa
Reviews.Content: I crashed at this hotel after a hugely hectic business trip to France in November 2007. I was pleasantly surprised that despite the 3 star ranking, the rooms were large, and the bathroom was way better with large compartments. The staff was super friendly and they had wireless internet, which is great! The best thing about this hotel is that it is fairly close to main attractions in Paris. I walked to the Louvre (30 minutes) and it is really close to Notre Dame (10 minutes) and is located close to the river bank in the Latin Quarter. However, it is far from shopping district and you need a cab to get to Tour Eiffel or the Champs Elysees (15 euros ride). Overall, nice hotel, but only to sleep in. There is no restaurant, and kitchen is tiny. But it is Paris, and for 175 euros you cannot find a bigger room than this, so I would stay there again if I am on business budget.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel In Paris ? I think so !”
Reviews.Author: ejwf
Reviews.Content: We are fortunate to have visited Paris 6 or 7 times over the past 15 years, but never before stayed in a hotel I would return to or recommend - until now. Whilst I am loathed to tell everyone about this hotel, judging by the number of reviews already on TripAdvisor I am not the first to want to share this little gem of a hotel, hopefully they will still have rooms available next time we want to go. The hotel is located on the Left Bank (south side of the Seine) close to Notre Dame, so you are ideally positioned to experience the majority of the main attractions of Paris. We had room 602, on the top floor at the front of the hotel, so we looked over and slightly down on St Severin church (beautiful both day and night) and in the distance across to Eiffel Tower - currently lit up light a lighthouse with sweeping beams of light at night. The room was of a good size (for Paris) although if very tall you might have a problem as the room is in the eaves so you lose some head height in part of the room next to the window. Although we were on the front, we had no noise at all thanks to the windows, the A/C in the room worked really well and responed quickly to any change in settings.... Bathroom - "compact and bijoux"! basin, with large mirror over, loo, bath with shower over, lots of towels, good hot shower, and all very clean and new looking, but again, like all Paris hotels not a very large space.
