Bed - very comfy, and 'proper' pillows Reception - staff very friendly and helpful, recommended a great restaurant (le Coupe Chou), and although we didn't need their services beyond this I felt sure that they were there to help guests rather than the usual feeling that you were disturbing them! Downstairs Area - really nicely decorated, plently of comfy sitting areas, beautiful books and magazines, daily newspapers - all very good. Breakfast - we did not take breakfast in the hotel, but this looked very nice and fresh and is taken in a very pleasant area towards the back of the ground floor... This hotel has everything you need, plus a few pleasant extras: good rooms, good location, comfort, cleanliness, helpful staff, plus a very comfortable, welcoming feeling we hadn't yet found in any other Paris hotel - we will return, hopefully very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Harry1Melbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights end of August, and were very happy. Our room was quiet with a great view on the top floor of St Severin and the Eiffel tower. although the room was small it was very clean. Found the staff to be extremely helpful. Wouldn't bother with the breakfast though, 12 euro for a croissant, coffee and a packet of corn flakes! Although it is in a rather busy touristy area, the Metro is close by. Be careful where you eat however, as both of us got food poisoning after ordering the "tourist" menu from different restaurants. Be prepared to spend a bit more and order a la carte.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: Infrequentvisitor
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 2 nights, on an all too brief birthday trip for my husband. I was persuaded to book this hotel due to the good reviews on trip advisor, and I wasn't disappointed. The hotel is in a very old building, and the reception area is beautiful. Our room was nice, though perhaps not up to the standard of the public areas. I think the rooms vary in size - ours was on the fifth floor, small, with a good sized bed and a dressing table with a small tv, drawers, a minibar (with reasonably priced drinks) etc. The wardrobe area was separated by a door and was in between the bedroom area and the bathroom. The nicely fitted, small bathroom was well equipped. Our room faced the ancient St Severin Church, and even had a distant view of the eiffel tower! Fantastic outlook. As the area is so busy, well into the night, I was a bit worried about noise, but the room was extremely peaceful, with blackout curtains to cut out the dark. Helpful, friendly, english speaking staff - I would highly recommend this hotel, and the location was just amazing. It is within seconds of many restaurants and shops, very close to Notre Dame, boat trips on the Seine, St. Germain. Perfect for a short stay - I didn't have to get on a metro until I headed back to the airport. We didn't try the breakfast, but would recommend the branch of Patisserie Paul on Boulevard St. Michel - beautiful pastries, sandwiches and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Mawson
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights at the beginning of September. The was large and spotless the bathroom a fantastic size with a great bath to soak away all aces after hours and hours of walking discovering Paris. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. I suggest you take breakfast in the hotel as you got a lot more for your euro than elsewhere. The only thing that was missing was tea and coffee making facilities in the room - that would have made it perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Could Be Finer”
Reviews.Author: UmaOwner
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived (too early to check in) until the moment we departed (too late to change our minds and stay) this was the perfect hotel: the location prime for a first time tourist (my wife) with everything from Metro stops to Notre Dame almost too close for comfort; the staff to a person remarkably kind, courteous and helpful; the room wonderful (and the bath too) - we were in 602. We didn't take their breakfast because of the price and the desire to get out and try different places. Rue St Jacques gets quite busy and noisy at night but you never would know it in room 602. We were there in the heat of the summer and the AC was a blessing. This was a perfect base from which to explore Paris. I'd be surpised if we don't go back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: mdgpcp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for five nights at the beginning of September, after having picked this hotel as a result of the good reviews on this site. We were not disappointed. We had a sixth floor room which gave us a great view of the Eiffel Tower. Although not large, the room and bath were spotless. The staff was very helpful. The hotel is very well located - one of the stops for the hop-on, hop-off bus is almost across the street and another just down the street in front of Notre Dame. There are many places to eat and much to see in this area. We would highly recommend the multimedia presentation at Notre Dame (every night at 9 p.m. except Friday). Overall, a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: bettyboop81
Reviews.Content: My mum and i stayed in this delightful hotel for 4 nights. location is brilliant, right next to notre dame, lots of cafes and restaurants nearby. hotel is small, quaint and full of french charm and character.rooms a little on the small side but are very comfortable and have everything you need.Ours looked out onto an internal courtyard and we did not hear a sound from the busy street at night. breakafst is 12 euro, we did not get it tho, plenty of cafes nearby. I would highly reccommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: mrsulethguy
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here in September and were very pleased with this hotel. We were traveling with two children and therefore needed a larger room. The room was spacious and clean and very comfortable. All the staff were very friendly and made us feel welcome. This hotel is located in a very busy area but I did not hear any street noise from the room. We were in the back of the hotel and so only had a view of the courtyard (rooms ending in 4 have this orientation). They offer breakfast for 12 Euros but we did not try it. There are many cafes and markets in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A little Franch gem!”
Reviews.Author: wheresnext
Reviews.Content: Just returned yesterday from a 3 night stay at the Henri IV and had to feed back on what a delightful hotel this is. The reception staff are very polite and welcoming and although not luxurious it certainly has french charm about it. Would recommend it to anyone. Room 401 has a wonderful outlook with a balcony and a great place to sip a bottle of wine! Thought it might have been noisy at night time but once the balcony doors were closed it was silence. A great stay all round.

Reviews.Title: “This is, surely, a real gem!”
Reviews.Author: Mekitar
Reviews.Content: This is so far to me the best tip in TripAdvisor website. A magnificent hotel, extremely well-located, with a great value mainly if you consider you are in Paris. - Booking - easily made directly from the hotel website. You only need a CC to guarantee your reservation. Hotel staff answering very quick. - Arriving - either by train (in Charles de Gaulle airport take the RER B, direction Robinson or Saint-Remy and get off in Saint Michel-Notre Dame station; it's a 35 minutes journey, EUR 8,50 each, and leaves you a few steps from the hotel) or taxi (about EUR 55; 30 minutes). I recommend the RER. Easy, safe, cheap and fast. - Check-in and Hotel - also easily made. The rooms on higher floors are better because of Saint Séverin Church great view. Air conditioning was perfect, one of the bests I've ever seen. Minibar with some beverages (from juices to Cokes, all of them EUR 3). Free and fast wireless internet access. Bathroom is nice and the bed, huge and comfortable. Furniture's a little old, but who cares? (at least I didn't) There's also a little closet next to the door. The windows and the walls don't let you hear any sound of other room, even if there's a party over there. We didn't try breakfast in the hotel (EUR 12 each) as there's a LOT of cafés and restaurants near. The staff at front desk is very helpful and gives you good tips about the main touristic places. - Location - absolutely perfect. Walking 3 minutes, you're inside Notre Dame. The hotel's almost "in" the Quartier Latin with tons of good restaurants, shopping, a great nightlife and tons of tourists walking until late at night. It's short walking distance from the Panthéon, Luxembourg Gardens and the elegant Blvd. Saint-Germain, with Paris best cafés. Also near the Louvre and a little far from Eiffel Tower but, if you don't mind walking near the Seine river about 20 minutes (the views are breathtaking), for sure you would not spend a dime with transports. The location of this hotel is the main thing you have to consider. - Tips - do not lose the opportunity to eat a great Gyros in one of the dozens greek restaurants near the hotel. Try one crépe sucrée in Créperie de Cluny. Taste a raclette in Saint-Emilion and some hours with good food and music in Chez Clèment. And make sure you'll visit Luxembourg gardens. Amazing and so beautiful. Henri IV, if you consider all those things, is a perfect choice if your main purpose in travelling is not luxury but convenience and good service. Do not hesitate in booking. I will not my next time.

Reviews.Title: “magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: travellerd0wnunder
Reviews.Content: My wife, youngest son and I stayed there for 2 nights in August 2008. This is a magnificent 'gem' in a great location about 200 metres from Notre Dame. The staff were friendly and vrey helpful at all times - in fact it was the only hotel in France that we stayed in (over 3 weeks) where we received assistance with our luggage to the room. The room (a triple) was very roomy and well furnished and certainly much larger than any other 3 star hotel room we had stayed in. The bathroom was large, modern and clean. Wi-fi was free and worked fine. Overall this was a perfect hotel that I would fully recommend to anyone wishing to stay in central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have had a nicer stay...”
Reviews.Author: TravellingCircus1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice during our French holiday - the first time was so lovely that we decided to go back! After reading all of the great reviews on Tripadvisor we decided to book this hotel and we were not disappointed. During the first stay there were 4 adults and 2 children so we booked a Double room for 2 adults and a Triple Room for 2 adults, a 3 year old and a baby in a cot. In the Triple room we had more than enough space for a cot, two suitcases lying flat on the ground and two children and all their toys! The bathroom was large and had a bath/shower which was fantastic for the kids. The beds were singles pushed together which gave you a bit more space as opposed to the european double beds! The Double room was also very large by Paris standards and it too had two singles pushed together (this was requested by us) and had a great view straight over the church. On our return we only had the baby with us so we booked a double room which unfortunately was slightly smaller and could only just fit in the cot alongside the bed. It was a true double bed so make sure you request a double room with two single beds to ensure you get the larger room!! The hotel staff were wonderful, especially Laurent, who was fantastic in getting us large taxis at the last minute for us! Hotel location is great for walking everywhere, which is what we did - even down to the Eiffel Tower and back. We initially thought travelling with 2 very young children would be really difficult, however this hotel was a fantastic find in terms of having a large room, the cleanliness of the hotel, lovely staff, good location, and of course, at a very reasonable price! I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family, and especially recommend to other families travelling through Paris.

Reviews.Title: “another great stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: smoggy1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Henri IV RG in April 2008 and we were already planning our next visit before we left Paris. We would not usually go back to the same hotel but there was never a doubt that we would return to this one. The location is fantastic if you are on a short trip. We walked everywhere: the Marais, The Pompidou Centre, The Louvre and Orangerie and the great night life around St Germain. The only time we needed to get a train/metro was on arrival and departure. The staff are wonderful. They are always friendly and helpful but are equally happy to leave you alone with a pleasant greeting. (Thanks again for finding my daughter's bookmark!) Our room (501) was even better than our previous one. A great view over St Severin with the Eiffel Tower in the background - fantastic light show at night on the hour. All in all a great hotel in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel, perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: PariSPQR
Reviews.Content: After several months of research, we decided on the Henri IV Rive Gauche for our Honeymoon and first trip to Paris. We had an absolutely wonderful stay in Paris, and much of it had to do with this charming Hotel! The room was small, of course, but I certainly wouldn't expect anything larger in the heart of Paris in this price range. Most importantly, the room was spotlessly clean and well decorated. We had a 5th floor room overlooking St. Severin church and even had a great view of the Eiffel Tower in the distance! Aside from the room itself, the location could not have been better for us! Almost all major sites in Paris were within walking distance and the St. Michel metro stop was only a short walk away. Anyway, this Hotel met our high expectations and we would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. The staff was very friendly and helpful and we have no complaints from our stay whatsoever! **One last thing, DO NOT make an international call from the room without an international calling card. We made 3 quick calls back to U.S. before we discovered our calls were costing us 24.89 euros for the 1st minute and 3.89 euros each minute thereafter. It was our fault for not asking sooner, but this mistake cost us over $200 for less than 20 minutes of calling!**

Reviews.Title: “An absolute gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: retiree2be
Reviews.Content: My daughter did the research and decided we would like the hotel, its location and its ambience. The contact person was polite and answered all questions and was helpful in all respects. We were not disappointed. The four of us (my mother, my sister and my daughter) stayed in 2 triple rooms. We had more than ample space. The staff was wonderful, pleasant and tolerant of our halting French which they supplemented with their knowledge of the english language. They kept our rooms clean and well supplied with the expected necessities. We were right in the heart of all the sights we wanted to visit and within easy travel by metro or taxi to all other sites. We felt safe, had peace, quiet and privacy. It was wonderful and contributed to a fantastic stay in Paris. I look forward to returning with my husband for a romantic visit to France. J'aime Paris! J'aime Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: iloveparis08
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel on the basis of other TA reviews for a romantic few nights away in Paris, and we were very happy with our choice. It's a small boutique hotel just a few hundred yards from Notre Dame and (thus) the Seine and despite the fabulously bustling location, our room was wonderfully quiet. Reception were ready for us when we arrived (they said my name before I did!) and the hotel itself is full of character but looks very new, clean and well maintained. Only one flaw - the bed was pretty uncomfortable but the (nice ensuite) room was great in all other ways; this is the reason for the lost star. Gimme a softer bed and it would have been 5!

Reviews.Title: “A rare find in the Latin Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Glucan
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a true gem. I came across the Henri IV by reading reviews in TripAdviser. I wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter and this quaint little hotel sounded like an ideal place. I contacted the property directly and booked the room. When we arrived we were pleasantly surprised to find that the Henri IV is ideally located just a block and a half from Notre Dame and right in the middle of the Latin Quarter. Our room looked out over the church across the street. The window box with geraniums along with the sights and sounds of the Latin Quarter only added to the overall ambience. The hotel is beautifully appointed and the rooms, while small, are very comfortable. The hotel staff were absolutely wonderful and catered to our every need. Every day we went walking in the Latin Quarter where we visited many of the small restaurants. The hotel is also within walking distance of the University, St. Germain, St. Michel, the Seine, the Lourve and many of the other Paris sights. I could say a lot more about this wonderful little hotel, but I can summarize it by saying that we are already planning our next visit to Paris, but that’s only if we can reserve a room at the Henri IV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: esp123
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for our last night in Paris. I wish we had stayed here for mroe time. The staff is great, the hotel is great, the location is great....I guess if I have to try and think of a negative the bathroom was a little small. What a great place! The location in the Latin quarter is really where I would want to be when I return. I will either use this hotel or find a nearby apartment next time we go to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for the night”
Reviews.Author: travgalincal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of our French vacation. The hotel was small but nice, and the air conditioning was great. The windows also did an amazing job of silencing street noises. For us, it was a good option for one night's stay. At the beginning of our trip, we stayed in an apartment near the Musee d'Orsay for four nights. I much prefered staying in the quieter neighborhood in the apartment. Also, I would recommend staying in an apartment if your stay is more than a couple nights. It is more convenient and cost-efficient. Still this hotel is very conveniently located, and the bed was comfortable. If you like to be in the middle of the action, it is a good option. The front desk staff were not terribly helpful in helping us find a special place to have dinner for our last night in Paris. We ended up calling on our own. But they were helpful in other ways - booking, check-in/out, brought us an iron and ironing board.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Muzz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 3 nights at this hotel, at the tail end of 2 months back packing through Europe, and thought we would splash out once in Paris. This place was perfect in every way, friendly and helpful staff that all spoke great english, rooms were very comfortable and such a pretty view of the St Severin church across the road. Traffic noise is audible only if you have the windows open, and the air conditioning in the room is very quiet. We found parking 5 mins walk away in an underground carpark, expensive but you do get a discount if staying 2 or more nights. Great location for exploring the St Germain and latin quarter, Notre Dame, and the Hop On Hop Off bus stop was only 5 mins walk away. We found the Metro easy to use as well. All in all, a wonderful base to explore Paris, would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view, great location”
Reviews.Author: ecambridge
Reviews.Content: The rooms I booked for myself and my 16 year old niece were on the small side at the Henri IV, but the view from the windows more than made up for that. We were on the 5th floor, gorgeous view of Saint Severin church and the Eiffel Tower in the distance. My niece had a lovely windowbox with red flowers at her window. The front desk staff were always friendly and spoke fluent English. One of them even called a restaurant we were interested in to make a dinner reservation for us. The TV is very small and has only one English channel, CNN. Rooms and bath were very clean. You have to leave your room key at the front desk whenever you go outside the hotel. With the windows closed, things were quiet, but the area is a busy one with lots of traffic, and if you leave the windows open you will hear the sound of motorcycles and the ever-present sirens almost constantly. However, it was great being able to walk to Notre Dame in just 10 minutes and in the other direction you can reach Boulevard St. Germain in about the same amount of time. I think if I returned to Paris I would rather stay in a quieter district, perhaps close to the Luxembourg Gardens near St. Sulpice. But if you don't mind a lot of traffic and activity, the Henri IV is great and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect getaway”
Reviews.Author: shellypops033
Reviews.Content: My husband and i booked this hotel on Expedia using the Travel Advisor reviews. It was excellent. We enjoyed two nights in Paris, without our children - bliss! The hotel was perfectly situated, very nicely decorated and just a delight to be in. With so much on our door steps, we couldn't have stayed anywhere more perfect. Definately ask for a room at the front and on a high floor - we looked straight over St Severin on the fourth floor and could just about see the Tour Eifel. We ate at the Coupe Chou -http://www.lecoupechou.com/ which was gorgeous - a real French experience. We also ate at the Auberge de la Reine Blanche in Ille St Louis which was cheaper and more rustic but lovely none the less. Definately head off the beaten path. Would definately go again but might need to take out another mortgage - v expensive!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ridgevalley
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Henri IV for 6 nights in May. It was our second trip to Paris. You can't beat the location as it is near Notre Dame with lots of restaurants and nightlife nearby. The Metro is within a couple blocks. Our room of course was small but clean, quiet and comfortable. Our room, 501, was directly across from St Severin and the top portion of the Eiffel Tower could be seen, particularly at night when it is illuminated. The English speaking hotel staff was friendly and helpful, particularly Frederique and Josephine. We arrived early, and Frederique was kind enough to bring us some coffee while we waited for our room to be available. The room had a safe, hairdryer and small TV. Closet storage was adequate. The breakfast at the hotel at 12 Euros per person is expensive and not worth the cost. Try one of the many cafes, creperies or grab a McDonald's coffee and Egg Mcmuffin for 2 Euros and save your cash for lunch and dinner. The street outside the hotel is lined with ethnic restaurants and there are many other restaurants in the small streets near the hotel. If you're looking for a reasonably priced (by Paris standards)quality hotel in the heart of the tourist area this is it! Don't pass it up!

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: whatchamean
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to say that we read about Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche on this site and all reviews were good (unusual) so booked there and were most pleased also. The whole place is very clean and the front desk is most pleasant and helpful. It is one block from Notre Dame and the metro if you want it but you can also walk to a lot of things of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Oregonartlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Henry IV 5 nights for our first trip to Paris making my decision based on Trip Advisor reviews. The reviews are very accurate and we were not disappointed. This is a smaller boutique type hotel with loads of charm. We had a nice cozy room, nicely furnished, the bathroom was tiny but we didn't mind. We had a great view of the church (St. Severin) right outside our window, and we could see the tip of the Eiffel tower! The hotel is located on a busy street, but we heard no noise at all with the windows shut. We arrived early by an overnight train from Venice and we were really tired, our room was ready and they let us check in super early. Helpful staff, great restaurants nearby, and super convenient to Metro, RER with the Seine just two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Central , Charming and Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Jay70
Reviews.Content: Easy to find - very central - stones throw from Notre Dame - ideal location - very helpful and friendly staff - clean and bags of character. Recommend 100%

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Rohickey
Reviews.Content: LOCATION - Excellent, less then five mins walk from Metro / RER station. Getting there from CDG was a breeze. The immediate area is a bit touristy, but walk a further five minutes and you are in the heart of the Latin Quarter. Also very convenient for Notre Dame, Lux Gardens; ROOM - Very small, but very tidy and with a good shower. First night (Sunday) was noisy outside, other nights no noise, but I'd recommend asking for a room at the back; STAFF - Friendly and efficient; BREAKFAST - Had it there one day. Steep at €12 a person when you can get the same half price down the road; Overall good value for money at €180 a night. We'll be back in Paris in November and will be staying here again, which I guess is as good an endorsement as can get!

Reviews.Title: “Great Paris stay”
Reviews.Author: ouchiwoowoo
Reviews.Content: Our third stay in Paris and we were wanting a well located decent size room for a good price- like everyone! Could not have been happier. Room 104 is huge by Paris standards- including an amazing size bathroom- for Paris! Quiet as away from the street, great air con- not always the case in P Paris in May. Location could not be better- close to RER from either Orly or CDG airports- so easy, great restaurants, St Germain, shopping- plus not too far from all the right bank action as well. Great professional staff, free internet access and WIFI. Could not be happier for the location and most importantly the price!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MarkMorb
Reviews.Content: As an avid Tripadvisor junkie I spent several weeks choosing a hotel for my first visit to Paris, and I'm really pleased we chose this Hotel. The Location is superb, 5 mins from St Michel Metro and loads of restaraunts, cafes and bars in the immediate areas. We had a room looking straight out over St Severin, lovely (room 202). The rooms are small but nice and clean and the modern bathroom was a very good size. We found all the staff helpful (only the guy at the front desk on the last day we were there was a bit terse). We tried to use as much French as possible but when needed all the staff spoke very good English, (again with the possible exception of moody guy who either couldn't or didn't want to understand English very well). We did not have Breakfast at the hotel as there are so many places out and about that it was nicer to go out to a cafe. My partner has been to Paris before (2 times), but both times has stayed in the more upmarket centre of Paris. This was the first time she had been to the Latin Quarter, La Marais, Sorbonne area and she loved it. It was wonderful walking out of the Hotel door turning right, walking 100 yards and there in front of you is The Seine and looming over it Notre Dame. We will definitely try and return to the Hotel on our next visit to Paris (hopefully not too far in the future).

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Passport78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 days in Paris at Henri IV Rive. We absolutely loved it! It was our first time in Paris, so we were really nervous about choosing the right hotel in the right location. After about seven months of research, we chose Henri Rive IV. It was the best decision we could have made. I must first start out with the staff, wonderful! They were so helpful with everything from directions to helping us with the internet, they even offered to let use the hotel's computer at the front desk to check our e-mail! Next the room itself, was what i like to call cozy, but was very well equiped and had a spectacular veiw of the Eifel Tower. Last but not least, the location, right across the street from the Latin Quarter which is a non-stop party, full of entertainment and plenty of places to eat. Thank you Henri Rive IV Gauche for making our Honeymoon in Paris spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected”
Reviews.Author: mps
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home yesterday after spending 3 nights at the Henri IV. Absolutely spectacular location! I have read reviews of this hotel and its sister hotels with complaints about the size of the rooms. With respect I cannot agree. We have travelled to France many times over the years. Rooms tend to be quite a bit smaller than North American rooms. Having said that our room was more than a reasonable size, tastefully decorated and spotlessly clean The staff were uniformly helpful, friendly and polite. Extemely close to the Seine and Notre Dame-that can be a mixed blessing with the crowds. However turn left out the front door and you are steps from Rue St Germain and a couple of blocks from the Sorbonne-here the crowds thin out unbelievably and you are spoiled for choice for good restaurants [of all price ranges] and good shopping. We will undoubtedly return next trip to Paris. My son and daughter in law have changed their plans to include this hotel when they "do" Paris in the fall based on our experience

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Bass_21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here from May 3-7 and were very happy with our choice. When arriving from the airport you need only to take the RER Blue line and you are only 2 blocks from the station so it was easy to find. The location is phenomenal as you are just 1 1/2 blocks from Notre Dame and the Seine and there are great restaurants everywhere. We stayed on the 6th floor and had a view of the Eiffel tower in the distance and looked straight out to St Severin church (believe it was room 6). The room was small but normal for Paris standards but there was enough room for bags and getting by each other. The bathroom was actually quite nice and a decent size. Even though we looked out on the street, noise was never an issue and I am a light sleeper. The staff were all very friendly and helpful with any request and the decor of the main area was also very nice and tasteful. This area is very busy and has lots of bars and cafes but it is easy to get away to quieter spots as well. Our room was roughly $280 a night and considering what we got in terms of quality, location and service, I consider that a good price by Paris standards and a weak dollar. I would not hesitate to recommend this lovely hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: lawnboy246
Reviews.Content: First time in Paris and friends of ours recommended the Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche. Upon arriving, first thing we noticed was it was a rather small hotel, but no complaints there. We were shown to our room and for the next 7 days, we were actually in the hotel very little. Speaking of little, the rooms are relative small, but this seems to be the norm in Paris. The room, including the bathroom, were very clean, but it was the location that was incredible. From our room, we could see the Eiffel Tower. Now you cannot beat that of waking up every morning and seeing the Eiffel Tower or before you go to bed each night. Right across the street was the Latin Corners where there were all sorts of restaurants. Two blocks up was to the Metro. Across the bridge was Notre-Dame.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: threeoaks
Reviews.Content: Lovely little hotel right in the heart of the Latin Quarter minutes from Notre Dame. We were made to feel very welcome, room clean and well serviced and a good size for Paris. Breakfast too expensive for us, besides why stay in the hotel when in 2 minutes you can be sitting in view of Notre Dame eating breakfast whilst listening to the bells chiming – all for 6 Euros! We would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place!”
Reviews.Author: DadB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 days recently. Unassuming from outside, but very nice (if compact) inside, and the location is fantastic. We picked this property based on tripadvisor reviews and were not disappointed. (I asked if we could have a view of St Sulpice, and wow! did we ever! Gorgeous!) Staff is helpful and speaks english well. Some might find the adjacent pedestrian streets "touristy", but we thought they were vibrant and delightful. A great home base in the heart of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Young and in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ladyinthestreet
Reviews.Content: TThis hotel was exactly what you read in the reviews. It is in a FANTASTIC location (I'm sure you've read its walking distance to everything. It is, but also know that the streets are short and you will be crossing a lot of streets, which does slow you down. Also, the French are leisurely walkers, so if you are used to a New York paced walk, forget about it and relax. This is PARIS!) and the service was great. Fredrique always met us with a charming smile which helped in a city where no one really speaks your language. There were quality umbrellas as you walk out the door, and walking through the city in March at least, you will need a wind-resistant umbrella. It really is the little things. So, ok, the hotel is great. A minor quip: We had room 601, a triple room that overlooked the church. There was a rattling coming from the heater, and on nights when your body is sore and aching and its tough enough to fall asleep as it is, this noise didn't help matters. We alerted the front desk, but it was never taken care of. This could have possibly been because they did not understand our complaint, but regardless, if you get 601, make sure the problem is dealt with. The reviews stating the RER is very close are true. However, after navigating the INSANELY disorganized CDG airport, the last thing you will want is to walk down a steep flight of stairs to the train with heavy luggage (there is an escalator UP but not DOWN?!). When you get to St. Michel, you will have to go up quite a bit of stairs. If you are not in shape, or if your luggage weighs more than, lets say 15 kg, you will not be very happy. If you have young kids or infants, forget about this option completely. Also, if you are taking the RER from CDG, don't be scared when the train doesn't stop at any of the stations. It is an express to the major stops, starting with Gard du Nord. I didn't know this and thought a bunch of awful thoughts, not limited to us ending up in the suburbs (not quite the place i want to be on vacation...). Thankfully, the French are actually extremely sweet when you treat them with respect, and a nice young lady helped us when we were about to freak out over this. On the way to the airport on our last day, we took a shuttle arranged by the hotel. Make sure you have cash for this, and a service fee (2 euros) for the driver. We were short one euro because we didn't know, and I am still embarrassed. Also, if you think the shuttle is a breeze, its not. Driving patterns are insane and at one point, you will be praying. You can quote me on that. Maybe. A few other tips: If you are one thirsty person, Paris is not the place to buy water bottles everyday. It gets pricey very quick. A liter of soda at the cheaper supermarket was about 3 or 4 euro. Also, the tap water makes your pee smell funny. True story. A few places i recommend: Crepes Cluny. Get the Comedie del Arte ice cream sundae with pear sorbet. It is absolutely unbelievable. Also go to Berthillion on Ille St. Louis behind Notre Dame, as has probably been recommended. It might very well be the richest, most amazing ice cream on the planet, and I've had a lot of ice cream My favorite was the white chocolate, but the regular chocolate was superb as well. Falafel in the Latin Quarter has great falafel. Croissants and pastries about ten doors down to your left when you are facing the church are great. Its named something with "__-& Sofia" in it. Tell Aziz , the guy who works in the morning,I said hi and that I'm sorry I never called him. I lost his number. I really did. Crepes Nutella at Boulagerie de Papa were the best. Look for the guy with long lashes and a funky colored hairstyle. He's married but nice to look at. If you are a fashion freak like me, you must visit 31, Rue de Cambon, the site of Coco Chanel's first haute couture store. If you love art, don't rush the Louvre and the D'orsay, and don't be cheap. Get the audio tour. Walk the streets at night (its safe and quiet) for the most thrilling views. Most of all, believe all you have heard about Paris. It truly is the most beautiful city in the world.

Reviews.Title: “A little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Cherry66
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for just one night and had a very pleasant experience. The staff were friendly and helpful and although the room was on the small side was very clean and comfortable, as were all areas of the hotel. The pros were definately its great location being just steps away from Notre Dame and with easy access to all other major attractions, and the great view of the church opposite from our room. Also the aforementioned pleasantness of the staff and general ambiance of the hotel. The only cons were really only little niggles but we had booked a twin room as we were two friends travelling together but the beds turned out to be two singles pushed together as a double - with no space either side to pull them apart, it was fine for us as it was only one night, but maybe would not have been so happy if staying a week! so beware if booking a twin room, it may turn out to be more intimate than intended. The only other slight niggle was the room was a little stuffy but upon opening a window, were over whelmed by noise of passing traffic, sirens etc. again, was not much of a problem for us but could be in the summer months, although I do beleive there is air conditioning. I would definately reccommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Noise”
Reviews.Author: Creemie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was featured on the 'Venere.com' website and I thought from the reviews and the photo's it was going to be lovely. The reception area/lobby was as described but the room we got no way resembled what I thought we would be getting. A bit disppointed to say the least. Beware that if you end up having a room street side that it is incredibly noisy - all day and all night as its the road that leads to Notre Dame and is a stones throw away. Aside from the noise and lack of sleep, the location is fantastic and there are lots of restaurants to choose from - I particularly reccommend Cafe de La Tourelle. This place doesn't seem to have changed in 70 years but the food is simple and excellent and good value for money - don't be put off by the shabby look of it, we were a bit dubious, but it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good crash pad....if a little expensive”
Reviews.Author: cornish007
Reviews.Content: No doubt about it ...the hotel has a great location just around the corner from Notre Dame, a 10 minute walk along the river to the Louvre, 2 stops to Gard du Nord on the metro, 10 minutes walk to the Pompidou centre, 10 minutes to Montmartre with one change on the metro. Surrounded by nice enough restaurants & bars (not gourmet restaurants by any means). Reception is lovely, excellent spoken english, always with a smile. Room not so good. It was fine, but for the money you pay i expected a bit bigger. We were in 308 with a view over the church at the front of the building. All very functional, clean bathroom, clean room, comfy bed, but not luxurious. One English TV channel (i know, you're not there to watch TV), and a very annoying broken toilet seat that managed to pinch your [-] every time you sat down. But great for a 2 or 3 night stay, you wouldn't want to stay any longer as the room is very small. I'd say the bedroom was 7ft x 10ft.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Citytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my son and daughter in February 2008. We had a very comfortable triple room number 304 which had no view but was very quiet. Bathroom small but fine. The staff were all very friendly and helpful and the public areas are charming. English newspapers available every day. We didn't have breakfast there because of previous reviews but there are masses of cafes and bars all around and plenty of places to eat in the evening as well over towards St. Michel. Ideal location only 2 stops on the RER from Gare du Nord. Only negative comment is that we didn't really need such a high standard of hotel given that we were only there to sleep! I would certainly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Greak location, but...”
Reviews.Author: DorkingRanger
Reviews.Content: Picked this hotel for it's great location and it certainly proved as good as we'd hoped in this regard, just minutes from Notre Dame and the St Michel metro/RER, and loads of restaurants and cafes in the immediate vicinity. The hotel room itself (room 103) was clean and well maintained, but was small and basic, with no view external view, small double bed not very comfortable, small TV with only one English speaking channel (CNN), basic toiletries and no tea or coffee making facilities. It was acceptable for our short 3 night stay but we would not have wanted to spend a week there. It certainly was not what I'd expected for a room described as a 'Superior Room'. But main problem we had was with the breakfast fee. We booked via Expedia and the room description stated that price included breakfast at 10 euros per person. However when we checked out the receptionist told us that breakfast wasn't included. She was adamant that the hotel never advertised rates including breakfast and also adamant that the hotel had never provided breakfast for 10 euros (breakfasts are currently shown in the hotel as 12 euros pp). When we produced a copy of our booking confirmation she then accepted that the price quoted was 10 euros but still refused to accept that breakfast was included in our rate despite this being clearly stated on the confirmation. We were handed over to speak to a hotel director by phone, who also refused to accept that our breakfast was included despite being faxed a copy of the confirmation. He was insistent that the statement ‘including breakfast at 10 euros per person’ actually meant that breakfast was excluded. He became quite rude, accused me of trying to blackmail him, and said that he would sue me if I left a negative review about the hotel. We were given no option but to pay the breakfast charge, despite protesting that the hotel had never informed us about it either at check in or at the breakfast itself. The breakfast waitress had also never asked us our room number as is normally the custom when being charged. The breakfast itself was very basic: tea or coffee, 1 roll pp, 1 croissant pp, orange juice, corn flakes, yoghurt. Perfectly adequate for an inclusive breakfast but certainly not worth anything like 10 euros, especially with so many cheap cafes and restaurants just yards from the hotel. (Many of the restaurants offer 3 course dinners for 10 euros or less!) It’s interesting to see that the room descriptions on Expedia have now been changed to say ‘excluding breakfast’. So I’m guessing that our room description may have been a genuine mistake rather than deliberate deception, but it was extremely poor customer service not to honour the confirmed rate. Given the rudeness of the director I will certainly never return.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Otis66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a six night stay at the Hotel Henri IV. After reading other reviews, we decided to book a triple room instead of a double because we wanted to have the largest room possible. We requested the highest floor possible, and we received just that! We were in room #601. It had an absolutely gorgeous view of St. Severin, and we could see the Eiffel tower in the distance. The room was very spacious and clean. The bathroom had double sinks, towel warmers, and all of the hot water you could ever need. We had two twin beds pushed together, and one twin bed off on its own. We only wish we got one of the rooms with an actual double bed! The hotel staff was very friendly and spoke great English. Our room was always made up when we returned from sight-seeing in the late afternoon and before we went back out to dinner. There was not an alarm clock in the room. The TV has a digital clock, but unless you want to ask for a wake-up call every morning, I would suggest bringing a travel alarm clock. Luckily, we picked one up in the airport on our way to Paris. Our only complaint was the noise (sirens and bar hoppers at 4:00am), but we expected this when we booked a hotel on the edge of the Latin Quarter. You could ask for a quieter room on the back of the hotel, but you would miss out on the view! The pros of this hotel, however, certainly outweighed the cons! We walked to almost everything, and when we chose to take the metro, we were near the St. Michel and the Cite metro. We did not have breakfast at the hotel. We either ate breakfast at the museum cafes or at a cafe. I highly reccomend Laduree (we went to the one on the Champs Elysees but they have other locations) for a delicious breakfast of macarons, pastries, and even bacon and eggs. If you wake up late enough you can even get cinnamon, sugar, and butter crepes just steps from the hotel. We loved Creperie Cluny (one street up from St. Severin, deep in the tight streets of the Latin Quarter). I highly reccomend branching out for all of your meals, but if you want a delicious bowl of French Onion soup and a glass of wine, Le Petit Pont is about ten doors down from the hotel, on your way to or from Notre Dame. Also don't miss all that the nearby Ile St. Louis and Ile de Cite have to offer. Amazing ice cream at Berthillon, wine and cheese shops, and wonderful places to eat and shop for gifts (L'Epiecerie is fabulous- it has over 70 types of preserves and countless types of mustards). Aside from the noise (which looking back adds to the charm), we could not be happier with the Hotel Henri IV. It was a wonderful place to stay on my first trip to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: myredmx5
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Henri IV Rive Gauche for 5 nights in February 2008. It was our first visit to Paris and we had little idea of where to stay and which areas were convenient etc. We chose the Henri IV Rive Gauche based on the Tripadvisor ratings and weren’t disappointed. Although the hotel is located on a fairly busy road we had a 5th floor room facing the road (with a distant view of the Eifel Tower) and could hardly hear a sound from the passing traffic. The double glazed windows did their job and with air conditioning it should be fine even in the height of summer. The hotel was 2 or 3 minutes walk to the Metro and RER, with a direct lnik to Paris CDG Airport. The area round the hotel was lively with many restaurants and bars serving a wide range of cuisines. The Notre Dame and Concierge were within a 5-minute stroll whilst the Louvre was about a 20 minute walk. The room itself was very clean and well furnished with an excellent bed and spotless bathroom, with bath and shower. The room wasn’t spacious but was more than adequate for our purposes and came with individually controllable heating and air conditioning and an easy to use safe for storing valuables. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and breakfast was available for 11 Euros but we preferred to sample various street cafes in the vicinity. I would thoroughly recommend the hotel and the area for anyone visiting Paris on a sightseeing trip, excellent quality, convenient and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Break Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bmw2000csi
Reviews.Content: This was a short 2 night break from Ebbsfleet, Kent using Eurostar taking 2 hours 10 minutes to Gare du Nord. The hotel was chosen based on reviews here and we were not disappointed. The booking was made through Expedia and was confirmed by them. For £125 a night the location could not have been bettered and was exactly as ordered. The room was small but very well maintained with good storage in mirror-fronted wardrobes, TV (CNN but no BBC), phone, minibar and free programmable safe. Typically for France there were no tea-making facilities. Room 401 faced the St Severin church and had a small balcony facing the busy main street. Double glazing and excellent blinds excluded light and traffic noise. The double bed was firm but very comfortable. The bathroom was small but had modern fitments, hairdryer, bath with shower and plenty of hot water. Clean towels were provided daily. Reception always had staff that spoke good English, were extremely friendly and helpful. We were able to leave luggage until our train left in the evening. Continental breakfast could be served in your room or the 12-place breakfast room adjoining the bijou lounge. Croissants, rolls, corn flakes, plain yogurt, fruit and tea or coffee were available for 11 euros. Opposite the hotel by the side of the St Severin church is a maze of lanes with numerous restaurants. Within 350 yards are several Michelin recommendations – most of which are behind the hotel by the rear of the Notre Dame. We booked a 3 day Zone 1-3 pass through Expedia which gave inclusive access to bus, Metro and RER plus free entry to La Defense, La Bourget and Saint-Denise Basilique. Unfortunately it had to be collected from Paris Visite which is opposite the Tulleries Metro – I anticipated I would collect it from Gare du Nord. Also included is maps of all transport and a booklet of discounts giving 25% off Bateaux Parisiens, 30% off Le Montmartrain by Sacre Cour, 10% and a free gift from shopping at Galleries Lafayette plus lots of minor discounts to Arc de Triomphe, museums, food outlets and – highly recommended – 3 euros off an 8 euro non-guided tour of the Opera House – stunning! The quickest way of getting to the hotel from the Gare du Nord is to take the RER 3B to St Michael Notre Dame – just 2 stops, with 5minute travel time. When we return to Paris we shall certainly use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Minutes walk to Notre Dame”
Reviews.Author: su_o
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay here; the location is spot on as there are lots of little streets running off the main road with a great choice of restaurants and cafes. The hotel itself is quite elegant and the staff helpful and pleasant. We stayed in room 104, which is at the back of the property. The room was lovely with a very large bathroom (especially for Paris), however I would have preferred a room on a higher floor at the front of the property (although we did not have to worry about traffic noise!) We did not have breakfast at the hotel as there are plenty of patisseries nearby. This hotel was very clean, nicely decorated and had lots of original features - I particularly liked the lobby area. There was a fridge in our room, but no tea/coffee making facilities, which would have been useful. Our room was warm, spacious and the bed was very comfortable. St Michel metro was only around 3 mins walk away. Paris is not cheap, but compared to previous stays this hotel is fantastic value for money and I hope to go back again soon. I would recommend getting a boat trip from Pont Neuf at around 6pm. You get to see the sights at dusk and when the lamps light up across the bridges, Paris looks very beautiful indeed. If you book online you get a 4 euro discount per person. http://www.vedettesdupontneuf.com/ If you enjoyed the film The Da Vinci Code then you can download an audio tour and print out a map to walk around sites from the film and book. We found this a great way to see different sites in Paris, but be prepared to pause your i-pod whilst you catch up walking! It took us a very very leisurely 2 hours. http://www.walkingthedavincicode.com/walkingtour.html

Reviews.Title: “Until The Next Time!”
Reviews.Author: Peewak
Reviews.Content: Excellent short stay in this friendly,clean,well-run hotel.Prior to arriving,I requested a high rise room overlooking the St.Severin church,across the road and that is exactly what I got. I also noted that I would be arriving at @11 a.m. and the charming receptionist,Nathalie,immediately responded to say that ,if the previous occupants had checked out early,they would try to have the room ready on our arrival and it was! I also asked the hotel ,in advance of our trip,to book a table for dinner at Le Coup Chou restaurant as their website was down.Again,no problem and the restaurant were expecting us at the appointed time! All staff helpful re- opening times of museums etc.- free daily newspaper in the lobby.Didn't take breakfast in the hotel as countless boulangerie/patisserie in surrounding area. Would thoroughly recommend Le Coup Chou(about 5 min. walk from hotel)for ambience and genuine Parisienne dishes at a reasonable price.Also recommend,for lunch,the Leon Belgian cafe on St.Germain = fabulous moules mariniere,frites,belgian mayo,and,especially,glass of Belgian beer - all for 16.50euros! Tip=if going to Versailles,get the RER train from St.Michel de Notre Dame but ask for an inclusive train/entrance ticket = cuts out the huge wait at the chateau entrance. Location,service,comfortable room - Henri 1V offers excellent value and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ksmith38a
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in December for a Xmas shopping trip and to see a concert in Paris. We chose this hotel as the reviews here were favourable. The hotel is easy to find, being no more than a few minutes walk from the Metro station which gives easy access to the airport and other transport links. Its located in an ideal place for sightseeing and touring Paris. Its minutes from Notre Dame, and on one of the tour bus routes. The other tour busses are easily found near Notre Dame cathedral. The staff on arrival where friendly and courteous, the reception are is well decorated and has a nice warm cosy feeling to it, especially when arriving on a cold December evening. The room although small was decorated nicely and the bed was good and firm. The bathroom was well equiped and the shower had good pressure. The mini bar was as normal for a hotel overpriced but none the less was well stocked. Being centrally located there are many places to choose from for eating out, there are many Greek and Turkish restaurants across the street and many bistro's and bars along the same roads. All in, a very nice centrally located hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for seeing Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bobbio
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel based on previous TR reviews and were not disappointed. It has a great location very close to Notre Dame in one direction and the Latin Quarter in the other. Reception was very helpful, and in particular recommended us Restaurant Balzar nearby, which provided an excellent meal. The room was warm, quiet and comfortable with a big bath.The bed was a wee bit short but I kicked the bottom of the tucked in sheet out to give me more leg room. The only small complaint, common to many French hotels, is the lack of any tea or coffee making facilties in the room. There are planty of cafes and restaurants nearby where you can get a hot drink but it does mean getting up, getting dressed, and going out. We look forward to staying at Henri IV on our next visit to Paris

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: greekvillaromantic
Reviews.Content: we just got back from a weekend and loved the henri iv. We were in room 602 at the top, with a lovely view over st severin and the eiffel tower in the background. It isn't a posh hotel, but just well run, well decorated and everything is as it should be. It is exactly what we were looking for. St Michel is as central as could be. If this was in the marais it would be twice the price- and it is 10 min walk across the pont - neuf - which is no chore at all.... i've never bothered to write in before but would recommend this place-

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: Margouille
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel. As expected for Paris, the room was on the small side but quite nice. The view over the church is very pretty at night. The location is a real bonus. 2 minutes walk to Notre Dame and le Quartier Latin. 10 minutes to le jardin du Luxembourg. Metro station not too far away. The girl in reception spoke very good English (to my husband... as I'm French) and was very pleasant. We didn't take breakfast at the hotel as it is usually not worth the money in France! Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: beltanebelasco
Reviews.Content: My senior age parents and I stayed at the Henri IV Rive Gauche from November 2 thru 10 in a third floor triple room overlooking a lovely little interior courtyard containing topiaries. The room was quite large (for Paris) and reasonably priced. The room was beautifully designed to make the best use of space and had calming classic modern decor. The bathroom was modern, sizable, and spotless. Special amenities included heated towel racks, a small fridge, and ample closet space--a particular treat for longer stays. Staff was gracious and helpful throughout our stay and particularly welcoming upon arrival. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning, and it was excellent, but rather pricey, as other reviewers have mentioned. Location is terrific, with many nice cafes nearby (especially recommend the one directly opposite the entrance of Saint Severin), with excellent value menus. Also my parents (both age 75) were able to walk to Notre Dame, the Marais, the Luxembourg, and the Louvre (a bit of a trek). Don't miss the Musee de Cluny, less than 5 minutes away--better than the Louvre if you have any interest in medieval and late Roman art. Metro and RER stations are nearby, which made further afield sights accessible. Altogether, we highly recommend the Henri IV Rive Gauche for a happy and memorable visit to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: Philly2Ireland
Reviews.Content: great little hotel just a block from Notre Dame. Property was convenient to metro and RER. we took RER from CDG and walked from there. There is a taxi stand at the corner. while it is near the touristy area, that means plenty of variety for food if you are not into getting out for the haute cusine. The room was nice and the hotel staff were very helpful and spoke english when needed. There was a little noise in the summer because the window was open and the rooms shared an inside courtyard. We have stayed at other places and really enjoyed the conveniece of this locaiton as well

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: TexasA69
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I spent 9 nights at the Henri IV in October 2007. We were in room 302 & had a fabulous view of St. Severin. I thought all the great reviews on Trip Advisor might be over the top, but they really were not. The staff was warm & helpful (especially Frederique!) I will definitely stay at this hotel in the future. Great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: asterixman
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in a double room for a week during the Rugby World Cup. I then came back for a weekend with her father and my father (to see another game) and stayed in a triple. Both rooms were excellent. I have no complaints whatsover about the hotel and cannot recommend it highly enough. Although the breakfast may seem pricey, the orange juice was divine and the higher price is worth the lack of faff of finding somewhere to eat. Great location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Rondorak
Reviews.Content: This 3 star hotel has a great localisation in the heart of Paris. It is way more attractive than the regular 3 stars I know, and can even be compared to some parisians 4 stars I've been to. Near Sorbonne, St Michel, Notre-Dame, etc. Metro stations and RER Train station to Orly et Charles de Gaulle airports at 2 min. walking distance. This hotel is clean and very well kept, bedrooms are very comfy (beware of the bed sizes though, 2 small beds do not do a queen :). Cherry on the sundae, the staff is extremely nice. Will go there again with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Super Location”
Reviews.Author: recurfizz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my dad for the France vs Ireland game during the rugby world cup. The service was excellent and the staff very friendly. The twin room was a good size for Paris standards, including a well sized ensuite with bath. We stayed in a room to the front of the hotel, overlooking the church across the road. The hotel is very well located in the Latin Quarter with Notre Dame a 5 minute walk away and the Louvre about a 20 minute walk. Also, there is a video of the hotel available to view on [--]

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mphb
Reviews.Content: Just returned 10/3/07 from 10 wonderful days in Paris & the Hotel Henry IV! Decided on this hotel from all the positive reviews in TripAdvisor and we were not disappointed at all. This boutique hotel is charming and the staff is beyond pleasant and friendly. Natalie & Fredericke were so delightful and helpful and spoke wonderful English. Lovely welcoming lobby where we enjoyed a bottle of wine one rainy night...Fredericke found us some wine glasses & cork screw and it was delightful. Our room on the 6th floor (we must have been neighbors with another recent poster!) was smaller than US types, but we had a queen size (almost) bed, desk, safe, TV and even a small refrigerator. Bathroom was great....loved the towel warmers! Very quiet air conditioning & double pane windows were a bonus. Our window overlooked St. Severin church with the Eiffel Tower in the distance...what more can you ask! They do have a continental breakfast available for 11 Euros which we thought ridiculously high. My husband walked a block or so to the local Boulangerie & brought back yummy breads and coffee for under 4 Euros. We originally made our reservations with the hotel by email in February and they didn't even require a deposit. Kept in contact with them, asking all sorts of questions, which they promptly answered....that was very reassuring! HIGHLY recommend this little hotel! So convenient to the Latin Quarter (which is quite fun), Notre Dame, St. Germain and the Metro. Marilyn San Francisco Bay Area

Reviews.Title: “Location and Service -- two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: No_Camping
Reviews.Content: Just a short walk from St. Michael Metro stop, this boutique hotel is a wonderful find in the Latin Quarter. On the recommendations from this website, we asked for (and received) the triple room facing St Severin church on the sixth floor. We had two singles pushed together for a king and an extra single. A large window opened onto Rue St. Jacques with another window on the other side of the room opening to the rooftops of Paris. Both windows (when closed) gave us ample sound-proofing from the street noises below so that we slept soundly the entire time. Valerie at the front desk was especially helpful. She was a wonderful interpreter and performed duties far beyond the role of "front desk clerk." There is a delicious continental breakfast which we ate on one occasion. The other days, we decided to get breakfast at the boulangerie around the corner -- just to pretend we were natives. Our room was very clean and we could not have asked for a better location. No, it does not have the antiques or opulence of the Ritz, but it is a very charming, centrally located hotel with a distinctive Parisian feel. We would stay there, again.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect small Paris hotel”
Reviews.Author: bonitabuffalo
Reviews.Content: As writen up in Trip Advisor's prior comments, 3 couples spent 3 nights there before heading to Bordeaux. The hotel, rooms and staff were excellent. Their web site was accurate with their pictures & descriptions. The people at the front desk made many suggestions, reservations for us - all excellent. The walking & metro convenience was well worth staying here. All in all, 175eu was a bargin for Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Henri IV, je t'aime”
Reviews.Author: Pianoman1980
Reviews.Content: The Henri IV Rive Gauche is a small, spotlessly clean and charming hotel. The location is perfect. We took the Thalys train and then hopped on the RER. Ten minutes later we got off at St. Michel Notre Dame where we admired the beauty of the Notre Dame, but you are also only 2 minutes away from the hotel. The location is very central so you can walk to a lot of interesting museums, sights, shopping areas, restaurants,... and in a minute you are at the river Seine which is lovely to stroll along. The staff is terrific. They always did their best to help. Especiallly Eric is fantastic and he loves to speak English. If you are used to US sized hotel rooms almost every room in Paris is small. The rooms in this hotel have a decent size compared to other hotels in this price category. Our room and bathroom was immaculately clean. We had a room at the back which was as silent as a farm in the middle of nowhere. Needless to say, we slept like a rose after long days of exploring Paris. We didn't take breakfast so I can't comment, but there are boulangiers and cafés nearby with breakfast menus. When I return to Paris I'll definitely stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Samits2003
Reviews.Content: We spent three nice nights at the Henri IV in May. This was a perfectly fine hotel. Staff was courteous. Rooms were clean. Location was ideal, within walking distance of many major sites and near two metro stops.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: AussiePen
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading great reviews on tripadvisor, and as the title suggests, I was more than a little underwhelmed. I am a tolerant person, and I also speak fluent french, so I did not expect there to be any problems. Firstly on arrival, we were greeted at reception with the key to our room, nothing more - nothing about the nearest metro, surrounding area, etc. Not fantastic, but not a deal breaker. The room was clean and well appointed, with a good location, but it was very small. But the icing on the cake was when the client in the room above us started a fire on their balcony by extinguishing a cigarette in a plant tub while drunk. We were rung just before 9am, with the front desk telling me (in french) to please be careful when extinguishing our cigarettes. I assured them that we do not smoke. She assured me that someone in our room must smoke because a burning plant had just fallen from our balcony onto the head of a passer by on the sidewalk. I again assured her that I was still in bed, and my boyfriend was in the shower, it was not us. She insisted that despite my denials it was definitely our hotel room, they could tell by looking up at the balcony. I had to put the phone down when I heard loud rapping on the door (which had a do not disturb sign on it). I found the house keeper there, who demanded to be let into the room. He ran past me to the balcony, only to find all our plants in tact. He leant over the balcony, realised it was the floor below, swore, and ran out of the room again. Funny story, unless you were the ones accused of lying When going to the lobby shortly afterwards, we expected at least an apology; instead we were thanked for our assistance in this matter. My parents, who were staying in Paris with family friends at the time, and were appalled at this story, and their hosts wanted to confront the hotel. I imagine most clients when confronted with such bad service would have shouted the house down. But we decided a suitable review on tripadvisor would do the job. We are aware that we are 22, and so can be underestimated. But youth should not be a determinant of lack of integrity. Please take note.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with the last 10 reviews”
Reviews.Author: zuttoman
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it was the highest rated hotel on Trip Advisor in a price range I wanted to spend. I agree with the past ten reviews. We sound like a broken record -- the hotel is in a great location, the staff is friendly, and the hotel is cute. Remember, it's a 3 star hotel in Europe so the rooms are small, the sheets are nice and clean but they're not 800 thread count, and sometimes rooms overlook the tiny courtyard (like mine did). I liked that because the room was quiet and I was mostly out enjoying Paris. Overall, it's a good choice, especially for your first time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: scarder
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 friends of ours stayed there at the beginning of July. This is a very comfortable hotel and a great value for the money. Excellent location, very clean rooms, quiet (we were off the street but our friends were on the street on the 5th floor and said it was quiet with the windows shut), and good, friendly staff. Would definitely stay there again. Brooklyn, NY

Reviews.Title: “Nice Value hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Febo17
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nicely situated near Notre Dame and is within walking distance of the shops and cafes of the St. Germain des Pres district. The hotel is clean and cozy. We booked a triple which was fairly spacious and well laid out. This a small hotel that is clean and comfortable within walking distance to many major tourist attractions. It does not have all the bells and whistles of convention hotels. However it is comfortable and it provides a relatively good value in a city where hotel rack rates tend to be inflated. Hotel staff was very friendly and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: yoeddie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and could not have been more pleased. The hotel is a "find", with a great location and reasonable price. Our room was larger than expected. Another couple had booked the triple and it was large by Paris standards. The staff was accessable and helpful. They recommended Le Coupe-Chou, a restaurant nearby but off the beaten track and we had a wonderful meal there. We will definitely stay here if we visit Paris again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Oaka
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in early June. Very pleasant experience. Small room, as usual in Paris, but very clean. People at the front desk are helpful and very nice. A/C was working, I guess, but very weak. Had to open the windows at night to cool down and heard some noise at night, but we were so exhausted by the end of the day, it wasn't really a problem. Excellent location. Close to the Latin Quarter which was quite the dissappointment. Very loud and pushy restaurant hosts. Don't even bother eating there. Food is cheap and so is the quality. Very nice pastry place by the St. Michel metro station. Ate there every morning. Very close to St. Michel Metro station (~5min walking), which gives you easy access to CDG and Versailles. A block away from Notre Dame. Internet access in basement with their computer for a small fee. Overall, if you're looking for a reasonable place at a reasonable price, give this place a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: divagirl
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at this hotel in the end of May 2007. I booked a triple room and there was no problem with my online reservation made directly with the hotel. The hotel is located in the heart of the Latin quarter surrounded by Notre Dame, St Severin and St Julian all within view. The hotel is small but tastefully decorated and our room and bathroom were large by european standards and easily accomodated the 2 of us. The hotel was spotless and the staff was helpful. Considering the location it was also very quiet. I chose this hotel after pouring over the reviews on this site and want to thank the TA folks who provided all the details which made this hotel a great choice. Its well located and was easy to find coming out of the metro (RER from Gard du Nord). After a long day siteseeing it was great to come back to what amounts to THE best neighborhood in Paris for restaurants, night life , street food, vendors of all kinds, amazing street entertainment, great shopping and more. Dont bother with the breakfast which at 12 euros is not worthwhile when for less than half we had fantastic breakfasts in a nearby cafe (Cafe Royal on St Michel). My only complaint would be that it was very hot in Paris during out stay and the AC did not work well so the room was a little stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: skeetspeacock
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 6 nights. It is spotless and charming and in a great location. There is not a thing that I would complain about. The staff was friendly, helpful, patient and kind. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just Returned - Loved It”
Reviews.Author: GROntario
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Paris, stayed four nights at Henri IV, great staff and hotel, best thing about it is the location, walked everywhere, only 2 blocks from Notre Dame, ten minutes to the Louvre, right in the middle of the Latin Quarter, fantastic restaurant area. Subway one block away, rooms were standard for europe but modern and clean, stayed on the sixth floor and had the Eiffle tower framed in our window, I would recommend the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet Staff, Clean Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JRSy17
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very neat and clean with lovely staff that were very helpful with booking us a tour and getting us anything we needed. We stayed there for 3 nights and it was really great. We had room 601 (Triple room) and we had a view of the Eiffel Tower, which was great. We had a deal with breakfast included - which was lovely. It has a great location, right near the center of Paris and minutes away from Notre Dame and the Metro Station -Saint Michel. We really could not have asked for more. We stayed at a few different places on our trip and this was by far our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location”
Reviews.Author: Family5_3home
Reviews.Content: Thanks to Tripadvisor we found this hotel in the middel of the Latin Quarter. It felt like setting Paris "on-hold" when we entered the doors. A quiet little hotel with an exeptionally serviceminded staff. We got the rooms ending with 3 - these rooms is facing a backyard - the rooms are small but quiet. If you want larger rooms ask for the rooms ending with 4 - the same price but much larger. The suite is on 601 but costs a bit more. The beds have madresses in the hard end of the scale. The hotel is not only situated in the Latin Quarter but is absolutely perfect located to everyting. Close St. Michel Metro. We will definetly be back - when in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks Tripadvisor”
Reviews.Author: Aussie013
Reviews.Content: For our trip last September 06, we wanted to stay in the Latin Quarter and thanks to Tripadvisor I found Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche. The location is fantastic, just across the river from Notre Dame. The staff were friendly and helpful and the room passed my bathroom inspection (no mould on the tiles). We had an inside room facing the courtyard. Not much of a view but we were there to see Paris not sit in a room. Our friends had a room facing the street. This had a nice view of the Church and they said it wasn't noisy. The rooms are small by Australian standards but reasonably priced considering Paris prices. I have recommended this hotel to friends going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location but just a warning”
Reviews.Author: papa-rupe
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for my daughter's 21st and can't really fault it. Lots of character, great location, friendly staff. But, it was the hottest weekend of the year so far (last weekend in April) and the hotel air-con is not switched on until May. The staff tried to help but the system needed to be cleaned before being operated. Fans were available but our daughter's room was right on the main road. Window open - noisy. Window shut - sauna! Not the hotel's fault but perhaps worth bearing in mind if global warming really takes off

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: CHELSEACHEF
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I decided on this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. It offers very comfortable accomodation right in the middle of a very lively area at almost any hour. We stayed in room 104 for 7 nights and were delighted that the room was very large and had a small area where you could stand outside and take some air. It was also in the back of the hotel, so we didn't hear any outside noise. Unfortunately our flight home was canceled after we had checked out of the hotel and had arrived at CDG. We returned at the hotel later in the afternoon and explained our trouble and were given room 401 for the one night. 401 was a much smaller room, but has a terrific view. We were charged $169 Euro per night which we felt was good considering that you are only 1 block from the St Michel RER which has direct access to CDG. In the same train station you can catch the RER down to Tour Eiffel or Musee D'orsay. We, like everyone else who seemingly thought the same, didn't eat breakfast for $11 Euro at the hotel. A croissant and a cafe au lait only cost about $3 Euro at any of the local boulangerie, and they are fantastic. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and the housekeeping staff was efficient and unintrusive. This hotels greatest asset is it's wonderful location. Sure there are other hotels that cost less, but you get what you pay for at Henri IV. I would definately stay at this hotel again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel. great location”
Reviews.Author: wandala
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location; nice, larger than usual Paris room (room 201..facing street, but windows block out noise very well. Strange things: breakfast was 11 Euros per person, so we went to the local bagel place and got coffee and tea for less than 2 E pp..but can't even get a cup of coffee in the hotel! And room cleaning person took our damp hand laundry and put it on the heated towel rack, with the heat on, while we were out. Seemed a bit intrusive. Nice all around otherwise, but you certainly paid for it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: maccawill
