Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel earlier this month and based our choice of hotel on travellers' reviews. We were not disappointed. We had a room directly overlooking St Severin and the main road and although a busy road the double glazing kept out the noise. The staff are friendly and helpful and speak good English although we tried to speak French as much as we could! The rooms was clean and the shower excellent. Cannot fault it. Be careful when ordering a taxi as they put the meter on from the point they leave to collect you. This can be a little expensive if the taxi comes from 20 minutes away as we found out to our cost. This is the same thorughout Paris apparently so often it is better to catch a cab on the street or at least try an order from a local firm.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this jewel of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MamaTex
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just got back from 9 days in Paris at this fantastic hotel. Not only was the location ideal for all of our sightseeing, the staff was beyond exceptional. All staff was friendly and helpful and answered every question we had. We only tried the breakfast once, so we couldn't really comment on that aspect of the hotel. We stayed in room 301 and loved the view of the church through our window. For my daughter's first trip to Paris, this was a wonderful way to introduce her to the best city in the world!!! She can't wait to go back, and we would stay there again and again, and would defintely recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: sheils628
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay at the hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche for a short time in mid-July 2006 and had a lovely stay. I reserved the room last minute and the hotel was very accommodating, providing me with a small but comfortable single room (probably the smallest on the property, but even then it was spacious enough for me and had a great private terrace). My room faced the interior of the building, so I cannot speak for the noise levels of the street-side rooms, but it was very peaceful. Considering the amount of traffic that the Latin Quarter -- and the rue St. Jacques in particular -- gets, this says a lot! Although I am a frequent traveler to Paris and wasn't in desperate need of amenities or assistance, I found the staff very helpful when I needed them (such as when we arranged my shuttle for the airport). In addition to the charming facilities, the location is great. The hotel is right across from St. Severin and just steps from some of the most romantic, exciting attractions in the city, being just a bridge length away from Notre Dame, a block from the Musee Cluny, and a few short blocks from St. Germain des Pres. If you are in town for the first time, or are returning for the ninth, the hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche is an ideal little spot and I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirlBelfast
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel for our first visit to Paris on the basis of its favourable reviews here, and we were so pleased with our choice. It is a really lovely hotel - the location couldn't have been any better, with the river and Notre Dame just a few steps from the door, and the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay within walking distance, probably about half an hour along the river (although we used the Metro a lot too - it's a great system, with a Paris Visite ticket we were zipping round all over the city with ease). The hotel has a very relaxing atmosphere, perfect after a hectic day of sightseeing - the street outside was always bustling, but as soon as you stepped inside the door, all was calm. Our room was perfect (301) with a view of the church, and all so clean and fresh. We found all the staff to be very pleasant and friendly, in fact nearly everyone we met in Paris was pleasant and friendly. We didn't eat breakfast in the hotel - most cafes nearby had a set breakfast menu for croissants, crusty bread, juice and coffee. Lunch was usually a three-course affair with a caraffe of red wine - a lot of places have set menus for 10, 12 or 15 euros during the day. Advice for visiting the Louvre and the Musee d'Orsay - go early to avoid the queues!!! They' re not joking when they tell you that in the guidebooks. We walked to the Louvre on Sunday morning just after 8.30am, and it was so beautiful, not a soul about, we felt like the only people in Paris - beautiful. We ran out of time and didn't see everything we wanted to in Paris, so will definitely have to go back again, and we would certainly stay in the Henri IV Rive Gauche Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location, Clean, Good Value for what you get - rooms are tiny though”
Reviews.Author: glasbcy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a good friend of mine 2/17-2/19/07 for our annual birthday trip. The location is absolutely superb. You can throw a rock to Notre Dame and the great restaurants of the Latin Quarter. The hotel is clean and updated (paint, furniture, etc) and the staff (although limited in English skills) is very nice - especially if you try to use your high school french. I always try and they always help. The rooms are extremely small (to be expected) and ours did smell a bit of smoke (but I always travel with Fabreeze and it did he trick). The bathroom is modern (no shower curtain of course-always puzzles me), but also small. I am glad I was traveling with my girlfirend and not my husband because the twin beds were for Barbies. I think next time I would get the largest room they had (180 Euro). We had decided to go budget and we really enjoyed our stay, but I don't think I could have stayed in that little room for more than 3 nights. Don't bother with the TV - it's small and shame on you for watching TV in the most beautiful city in the world. We did not eat breakfast there because there are thousands of cafes and bakeries right outside your doorstep. One important thing I did not see mentioned is that this hotel is close to the Notre Dame Metro stop which will take you to the Charles De Gaulle airport in maybe 20 minutes. It cost 8 euro as opposed to $50-70 to take a cab. Learn the metro! it saves you tons you can spend on fabulous meals and shopping.

Reviews.Title: “So Many Positives”
Reviews.Author: VTWindyrise
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from my 7th trip to Paris in as many years and my first stay at the Henri IV Rive Gauche. I have stayed at the two sister hotels on Iles St. Louis, which were perfectly adequate, but the Henri IV outshines them by a mile. The staff goes out of their way to be accommodating, the rooms are larger than your usual closet-sized Paris rooms, the hotel is perfectly situated between two major Metro stops, the availability of affordable restaurants is amazing and the view of St. Severin out of the rooms on the front of the hotel is fabulous. The best rooms by far are the front rooms on the higher floors, but they can be slightly noisy from traffic. If it is space, privacy & quiet you want then ask for Room 104. The bathroom is almost huge by Paris standards and the room, although darker than the others, is a wonderful size. This is an incredible value at this time of year and I will certainly continue to use it as my Paris base on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Well Located Hotel & Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: honestevaluation
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we found the Henri IV Rive Gauche to be very well located and a good value for our 10 day Parisian Vacation. The hotel is clean, the elevator/lift is convenient for your luggage or after you have climbed the hundreds of steps at Notre Dame or Sacre Coeur. The staff was fantastic. We were always greeted whenever we needed to pick up or drop off our key. While I am sure they giggled at our attempts to speak French, most of them spoke English fluently. Additionally, if we needed extra assistance with directions or airport shuttles, the staff was very helpful. Our toilet had a problem one evening and it was taken care of promptly. The housekeeping service was efficient, reliable and inobtrusive. In our experience, the staff was a perfect 10! We never had the breakfast at the hotel, per suggestions of other trip-advisors. We found that a hearty breakfast crepe of ham/cheese for 3.5 Euros or a 1 euro crossaint was a quick, inexpensive solution for us. There are also numerous cafes nearby with European & American breakfast options. We stayed in room 402. It seemed to be pretty normal sized, but European standards. It is small, but well laid out and was fine for tw of us. The closet space works well with 1/2 for hanging clothes and 1/2 shelving. This room overlooks St. Jaques Street with clear views of St. Severin and even a glimpse of the Eiffel's light at night. This room can, however, get noisy. I enjoyed the city sounds when awake and used ear plugs at night to ensure a restful sleep. If noise was an issue, I would choose room 404, which backs to the a pedestrian street. We would stay here again without hesitation. If you want a clean, well located room at a fair price, this is a fantastic option. Side notes for this location: Within 2 minutes walking: Notre Dame, Latin Quarter Dining Options of every variety, St. Severin, Cinema, Dancing, 2 Metro Stops & much more. Within 3-5 minutes: St. Michel Cafes & Shopping, Cluny Museum/Musee du Moyen age, Starbucks coffee (if you need something familiar), Flower shops, Pastry Shops, Chocolate Shops, Many retail options, Sorbonne, etc. We traveled in February and the weather was chilly, but it was still walkable outside with a coat on. We used the Metro only for longer trips and the time it rained all day. Other than that, we walked everywhere-Louvre, Musee Orsay, the Marais, Pompidou, Picasso Museum, etc.. Have a fun trip!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: Bootsy31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an incredible location very Notre Dame and the heart of Paris. In addition to be able to walk to Notre Dame in two minutes (if you're a slow walker), the hotel is right across the street from all the wonderful alleys of the Latin Quarter with great French food and every other ethnic food you can imagine just steps away. Plus, if you get lost wandering around the streets of Paris, all you have to do is ask someone to point you to Notre Dame and you're home! I stayed in Room 601 on the top floor, a triple room with three twin beds (two of them pushed together). Very clean and no hint of smoke in the room. There's a charming view of the church across the street and a little bit of street noise, but nothing awful. The bathroom was spacious by European standards, with two sinks and a decent water pressure and plenty of hot water. Only small shampoos were supplied, so bring your own lotion and hair conditioner. The staff was helpful and pleasant and everyone speaks English. I asked for help looking into ballet tickets, and the attendant contacted the Opera but found they were closed. She remembered to folow up the next morning as soon as the box office opened and called back to tell me tickets were available and she'd be glad to purchase them for me over the phone. My only complaint is about the exhorbitant rates for wireless Internet - 45 euro for three days access! The hotel has a communal computer downstairs, but you have to pay for access in 15-minute increments. For the price ($249/night) I don't think it's unreasonable to expect at least one computer with Internet access. Breakfast is overpriced (11 euro) so just walk around the corner for cafe au lait and fresh bread for half the price.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Cracking Price, PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: jamieandlaura
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel within yards of the Notre Dame. Finding the hotel upon arriving in Paris is easy as it's nearest Metro stop is Saint Michel - the stop for Notre Dame (located on line 4 - the pink one!). The staff are all friendly and polite and although we attempted French speaking they were happy to talk in perfect English to us. The room we had (303) was cozy, twin beds pushed together although we had asked for a double, we had also read about the views over looking the church and requested via email one of those rooms.. we didn't get this... not a major problem because the church view rooms were over a very busy road. The bathroom had a very powerful shower with unlimited very, very hot water. Our room had a telephone, a TV with CNN & Eurosports & a 'minibar' fridge which had various drinks all priced at €3.00. The hotel is cute, central, very clean and comfortable. The price for the pair of us in Mid Feb 2007 was €167.00 p/n.

Reviews.Title: “Second visit - even better than last time.”
Reviews.Author: wwr
Reviews.Content: The Henri IV is a perfect small hotel. This was our second visit and we were so confident we took friends and they loved it too. The rooms have had a coat of paint since last year and the public areas are faultless down to the umbrellas waiting by the door and the sweetie bowl. The staff were most helpful both before and during our stay. You couldn't get a better location and price combination - the rooms are small but where aren't they and the towels are properly sized for grown-ups. Stay here - we booked direct. The daytime reception staff speak very good English can't say about the night staff as we drifted past with a cheery goodnight after excellent dinners at Le Reminet and Atelier Maitre Albert - both highly recommended and steps away.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the locaton”
Reviews.Author: Jac&John
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Rm.302 which has a great view of the St. Severin church across the street from the hotel. The room was fairly small, the bathroom even smaller, and the furnishings were basic. I was a single traveler and had to maneuver my luggage right near the bed to have walking room, and I could see it being really tight for two in the same room. But this is typical of hotel rooms in Paris. Apparently the triple rooms on the upper floors are much bigger so next time I'd look into booking one of those. Overall I enjoyed my stay at the Henri IV -- mainly because of its great location. It's just a 2 minute walk to the Notre Dame, and if you keeping walking on the other side of the Seine River you'll get to the Louvre Museum in a short amount of time. We ended up walking to the Eiffel Tower from there -- that was another 1-1.5 miles but it's a pleasant walk along the Seine. There are lots of restaurants and bars right near the hotel, so there was no shortage of dining options or places to get small souvenirs for family and friends. I'd definitely stay here again but as I mentioned, next time I'll book one of the larger rooms on the upper floors.

Reviews.Title: “perfect small hotel”
Reviews.Author: chuckab
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor recommendation was on the button. Great Latin Quarter location ideal for walking everywhere - also near Metro station. Staff put many 5star hotel staffs to shame. Substantial excellent breakfasts are not included but woth the supplement. Front rooms on upper floors have view of Eiffel Tower through ancient church across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at Henri IV”
Reviews.Author: The_Stig
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Henri IV Rive Gauche on a recent trip to Paris for our first anniversary. I would post candid photos that I took of the hotel and room but it would be redundant, seeing that the same photos have already been posted by others. Anyway, on with the hotel... This very small and quaint hotel offers a lot of value. There are only 24 rooms in the entire hotel, so I was leery that the customer service would suffer when compared with the larger hotels. Not the case at all. The attendant at the front desk was very helpful with planning tours, dinner reservations and shuttles to and from the airport. They even managed to get us into a fantastic restaurant for our anniversary dinner (Le Compe Chou, highlt recommended). The public areas of the hotel are very nice and comfortable, and the elevator is of excellent size and in good working order. I followed the recommendation of the site and requested room 401 and was lucky enough to be rewarded with it! The room is small, probably smaller than 120 sq feet, but there are great details such as built in closets on either side of the bed, a towel warmer, and in the case of room 401, a small terrace where you can walk out on if you so desire. I will make the note and say that: DO NOT ASK FOR, OR FIGHT TO GET OUT OF ANY ROOM THAT ENDS IN 03. On the fire escape map they seemed to be smaller than our room and looked out on a courtyard. The rooms along the front of the hotel are much nicer. The location of the hotel was also stellar. In the middle of the Latin Quarter, a winding narrow labryinth of narrow streets, you will find endless dining opportunities, as well as bars and clubs. The hotel is also a brief 2 block walk to Notre Dame, and another 5 blocks from Le Pompedieu. Then you have the Metro station that is a block away and you have all of Paris at your fingertips. Some other things to comment about the hotel: * It seems as though all of the rooms can be smoking rooms, and while our room didnt reek of the odor, it was present in small doses, so be forewarned. *If you have a problem in small places or are travelling with more than 2 people, only consider the triple, there is no floor space for a 3rd person in any of the other rooms. *The building two doors down from the hotel seems to be undergoing some kind of reservation, so if you are a light sleeper you might have trouble. One morning the jackhammers started at 0830, but other than that, there wasnt really anything to note, and I am a light sleeper myself CONCLUSION: If you are looking for a nicely finished hotel in a great location for an out of this world price, look no further than the Henri IV Rive Gauche. The value that it provides allows it to challenge far more expensive and far more luxurious offerings in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't want to stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: Eric_and_Dora
Reviews.Content: Excellent boutique hotel in the centre of the lively left bank. Two minutes walk to Notre Dame. Very pleasant and helpful English speaking staff. We stayed for three nights at the beginning of November 2006 and they readily accommodated us when we had to return to Paris unexpectedly for an additional night a week later. We stayed on the 3rd floor and in a slighlty smaller 6th Floor room, both with enchanting street views. This hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more....”
Reviews.Author: HelenF66
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the start of November and it was superb. The hotel itself is spotless, the staff are friendly and polite. The location is perfect for catching the sightseeing buses to tour all of Paris as Notre Dame is a transfer stop for some of the buses. I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else in Paris. Helen, Limerick, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “A Paris Jewel”
Reviews.Author: theroys
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Henri IV for 3 nights in October and we just loved the hotel, the location and the staff. Room was very small, so if space is important to you, book a triple room for just a few dollars more. We stayed in room 502, which was very quite, extremely clean and had a fantastic view. The location of the property was superb. Just a few minutes to walk to the Louve, Notre Dame and hundreds of wonderful Paris cafe's and shops. The Metro line we needed to use was not working, so we used the bus (very easy to use and very reasonably priced). We contacted the hotel directly for our reservation and had no problems, got exact type of room we wanted. The breakfast at the hotel is pricey for what you get, but it is convenient. I would highly recommend the Hotel Henri IV for a great stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: TJS118
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in room 502...great view of St. Sverin and the Eiffel Tower in the background.....viewed light show every evening upon our return....lovely! We were on street side which was quiet with the windows closed, AC was working, but really not needed. One morning a small brigade of mounted police marched down the street...nice surprise. The room was small, but easily stored 2 large suitcases and a carryon bag. Closet storage was good with shelving. Room was very clean, bed linens crisp. Location is excellent...walk to Notre Dame, metro, much to see and do in this area. Great restaurants over the bridge. Service was pleasant and accomodating; saw many different faces at the reception area where you need to drop off you key before leaving and request it upon your return each time; held our bags on checkout day without issue for several hours, called for taxi service upon our departure.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone is right - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hylasgirl
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the reviews from this website. All of the postive reviews are right. This was a great hotel and I cannot say enough about its location. We walked everywhere from this hotel. The only time we took the Metro was when we went to Montmartre. We were in a triple room, 204, and there was no view to speak of. We were only in our room to sleep, so we didn't mind at all. There was absolutely NO noise and our airconditioner worked perfectly. The bathroom was interesting, with the tub being high off the floor and only a glass partition about 1/3 way down the side of the tub... it made for a wet bathroom after showering, but none of this was an issue for us. We never tried the television or the mini bar but they were there. The triple room was MORE than enough room for the two of us and all six of our BIG suitcases. We were leaving on a two week cruise after our 5 days in Paris so we needed the room for luggage. The room was huge by Paris standards. It was a great hotel and we will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just as great the second time”
Reviews.Author: travelbunny
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, with warm, helpful, friendly staff. The location is the best! I have now been to Paris five times and after one night this trip with my sister, we left her inconveniently located hotel to come back here. This time we stayed on the first floor and I didn't find the noise an issue at all. Our room was spacious and had a great view of the church. Last time we had the triple on the 6th floor and that is a lovely room. My sister and I would've taken it this time too if it had been available. The area is convenient with lots of great restaurants and full of character and fun. Make sure you check out the ice cream place in the restaurant area over the road as well...it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Canuck35
Reviews.Content: Very hard to add anything new to this post! We stayed in room 501 with a beautiful view. We slept at night with the windows open. Quite the view. The big difference here is the staff. Helpful, courteous, and professional. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great people, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: beckmanch
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 15 September through 22 September 2006. We stayed in a double room, 401 facing Rue St Jaques. Every night we had the windows open, with the curtains closed it was quiet enough for sleeping. The room has a small balcony which we could see St Severin and the Eifel Tower in the distance from. The hotel's location (50 meters from the RER B, 150 meters from the METRO) made for easy traveling around Paris. A 200 meter walk brings you to Notre Dame, and a short distance from there you can cross over to Ile de Cite with its less touristy shops and narrow streets. Easy walk to Blvd Michel, St Germain de Pres, Rue Rivoli, many resturants were close by, and coupled with the ease of the METRO made this an ideal location to stay. The staff at the front desk (particularly Lauren) is very helpful. They made reservations to restaurants and suggested shops to vist and even places to pic-nic along the Seine. The hotel let us borrow plates, forks, knives, and wine glasses for alfresco dining in gardens, on the tour boats,and along the Seine. The hotel is a tranquil oasis from the busy Latin Quarter which is across the street behind St Severin. I can not think of a better value or location for us to have stayed for our first visit to Paris. We would stay here again in an instant. Manchester NH USA

Reviews.Title: “Great - except for spotty a/c”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellerz
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, nicely and recently refurbished and furnished. Rooms are quite small, but you don't go to Paris to stay in your room. The staff is excellent - very pleasant and responsive. Our a/c did not work the first night and it was extremely hot in the room. There was nothing they could do that night except loan a fan. We didn't get much sleep that night, which was unfortunate. The next morning, they moved us to another room that was a bit nicer and had working a/c. You have to have working a/c in the room because if you open the windows, it's way too loud to sleep. With the windows closed, you cannot hear any of the street noise. The location is great. I would stay here again without question. The Hotel de Lutece is at a better location, but not as nice inside and is about $30 more a night.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 8 nights!”
Reviews.Author: dragonflyskies
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent 8 nights at the hotel recently. The positive reviews are all very accurate. We had a nice room on the top floor facing St. Severin & the Eiffel Tower. We walked everywhere & rarely even needed to rely on the metro (which was very close). Found lots of places to have breakfast every morning (didn't try the hotel's breakfast) and found all people in Paris to be polite & good-humored. I would stay at the hotel again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Yes! Yes! Yes!”
Reviews.Author: Lolafromsocal
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights at this hotel in July 2006 and loved it! Location is ideal, front desk help extremely helpful, rooms immaculate, beds comfortable - a homerun all the way around. We stayed in rooms 201 and 301, with views of the church. Our rooms were VERY quiet and the air conditioning was SUPERB. Wonderful water pressure, too. We took the hotel-arranged shuttle from the airport - the only way to go! Our flight home was very early so the hotel arranged a taxi for us, which also worked out great. While in Paris we walked to all the sights, and had a wonderful time. Would certainly recommend this hotel to others. Ours was a girl's trip - my daughter, two sisters and I - and staying at this hotel was my idea, based on Tripadvisor reviews. All agreed it was the ideal hotel for us while visiting Paris.

Reviews.Title: “A Tale of Two Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Crash2
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the first week of May. Great location, especially for a first time visitor. The Hotel is spotlessly clean and the common areas, though not large, are attractive. I think the Hotel is probably a converted townhouse or apartment building and, as a result, there's significant variation in the size of the rooms. Upon arrival we were shown a room on the first floor. The bathroom was very nice but the room itself was tiny, even by European standards. You could barely walk around the bed, not sure where we would have put our luggage. More importantly the noise from the street, even with the windows closed, was significant. That would have been a serious problem for my light-sleeping wife... When we asked to see another room, we were told all that was available was a triple on the 6th floor, another 20 euros/ night. WOW, what a difference. Room 601 was 3-4 times the size of the first floor room. It ran from the front of the building to the back, with a small terrace on the back. Similar great bathroom, unbelievable views, and much quieter. The extra 20 euros is money well spent. This Hotel offers singles, doubles, and triples. It looks like most of the triples are on the fourth floor or higher. My suggestion for two people: Book a triple. The extra room, extra distance from the street, and improved views make it worth the money. Do that, and I'd highly recommend the Henri IV Rive Gauche.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mediamama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche from June 25 thru July 2. The hotel was perfect. I cannot say enough about it. The location was fabulous, only minutes from Place Michel, Blvd. St, Michel, Saint Germain Des Pres, two metro stops, and Notre Dame. You are also just steps away from dozens and dozens of restaurants. We were in room 501 with a fabulous view of St. Severin and the top of the Tour Eiffel. Considering all the info we had read about small French hotel rooms, we were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room and thought the room size was extremely generous. There were two large closets, one with shelves and one for hanging clothes. We got three of our suitcases in the closets and had plenty of room for the other one in the room without it being in our way. There was a safe in the room and you set your own combination. There was a refrigerator stocked with drinks. The rooms are air conditioned with individual room controls. The bathroom was very modern with a glass door on the tub. The rooms have double-paned glass and room-darkening curtains so noise and light from outside was not a problem even during the World Cup games which were highly celebrated at the cafes on the corner. We never heard any noise from other guests staying at the hotel either. There was always a plentiful supply of hot water and excellent water pressure. The room was cleaned daily and fresh towels were provided. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our (high) Expectations”
Reviews.Author: Calzini-Rossi
Reviews.Content: Adding much to our wonderful family week in Paris, the Henri IV will definitely get our business again. Location is perfect, but the warmth and helpfulness of the staff is beyond compare, and the air conditioning was appreciated. Best of all, we needed a triple room, and theirs are incredibly spacious. We were amazed when we opened the door and saw the room: our son's "quarters" screened off from the main portion of the room, giving us all privacy. The bathroom was modern, marble and more than adequately roomy. Small enough to be able to send coffee to the room in the morning (3 Euros) within 5 minutes of asking - we ordered on the way back from the nearby bakery - we all agreed that the comfort and hospitality of this hotel rates another trip - soon! JB Sacramento, CA

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Henri IV Rive Gauche”
Reviews.Author: arejaival
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 nights at the Henri IV Rive Gauche in late June. We were on the 4th flour facing St. Severin. Even though it is a fairly busy street during rush hour, it was incredibly quiet. They are not kidding about their triple pain windows! The room was lovely with every amenity. It was small, but well appointed. We loved our balcony and often looked out to see what the action was outside. The staff were helpful and friendly. Breakfast is a good deal for 11euros in Paris. The location is very convenient as well. It was a respite in such a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Our review might be redundant, but it truly is a gem. We spent a week here on our honeymoon and it was the perfect place to get to know Paris for the first time. The location is unbelievable, with the Notre Dame, Ile. St. Louis, St. Germain des Pres, and the Latin Quarter so close by. The major musuems (Louvre, Musee d'Orsay) are all within walking distance. In fact, we got into the habit of walking absolutely everywhere, including to the Eiffel Tower which leads you through beautiful, charming neighborhoods. The Metro is just a block away, but why take it when you can stroll along the Seine (also a block away)? Tons of shops and restaurants nearby. We heartily recommend the seafood restaurant down the street from the hotel called Bar Le Huitres, as well as Le Tastevin on Ile. St. Louis. We had room 202, which looked directly at St. Severin church and Rue St. Jacques. The street noise got a bit loud at night but we didn't mind it, esp with the beautiful church view. Room was decent size and the modern bathroom was great. Lovely, charming decor throughout the entire hotel. We had no problems at all with our AC and coming back to our room after a long day sight-seeing was heavenly. I would stay here agai in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Most rooms are great”
Reviews.Author: sebinah
Reviews.Content: We stayed for several nights in May 2006 at Hotel Henri IV Rive Gauche. We found that all the wonderful things Trip Advisor says about this hotel were true - mostly. We ddi not need air conditioning during the time we stayed and the elevator worked. When we got there we found out they did not have the type of room that we requested many months ago. The first 2 nights we did not have the type of room it was essential for us to have. When we finally got that room, it was excellent. We were on the courtyard, got ventilation, no noise, could hear the bells of Notre Dame. However be warned, the rooms whose numbers end in 4 and are on the lower level are to be avoided - you look at out something which blocks the room getting much ventilation and the rooms are dark and oppressive in my opinion. The full time desk clerk tried to be helpful but was not well informed on obvious things .. When we asked where a laundrette was, she had to research it and we later found out the information to be not helpful and wrong - it was about a mile away, uphill. That being said, I think because of its location, price, and fact that it is in a old building and was converted to a hotel only about 4 years ago, it is like staying in a new place and the bathrooom are good. Just remember you do not get a large room in Paris lunless you are willing to pay a LOT. We absolutely would stay there again. In fact, I have already booked a relative to stay there. I have not figured out to mark the boxes but most I would mark excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights last week. Hot weather in Paris and the hotel was like an oasis. Small and charming hotel and very centrally located. Agree with all the good ravings of this place from service with a smile, to the clean and charming decorations, to the location in the middle of Paris within walking distance to all the sights but in the middle of the Latin Qtr. Loved the fact that you can pop into the islands and the Seine walkways and the close by Marais area, with the Latin Qtr and St Germain district in your backyard. A few of our tiny tips around hotel: - we buy our own mineral water and other small groceries. The convenience store along the crowded touristy street of Rue St Severin is a rip off. Go to the supermarket up Rue St Jacques just past Blvd St Germaine and they are at least 30% cheaper. - the Rue de Buci markets are only 5-10 min walk away. Loved the feel of this area, with fruit shops, bakeries and boulangeries galore and a full sized supermarket. The cafe opposite Paul serves great omelettes and coffee to watch the world go by.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: mikkitampa
Reviews.Content: We loved the convenience to Notre Dame, the river bus, the Metro, St. Germain, the Latin Quarter and the islands. The hotel was actually lovlier and nicer than I had imagined. Our view of the Eiffel Tower and St. Severin was fantastic. We were on the top floor. The bathroom was very modern and clean - in fact the entire hotel was very clean and beaurifully decorated. My only negative comments are that the a/c didn't always work - out of 6 nights it only worked 3. With the windows open, the room cooled down at night (which was the only time we were there) but we weren't happy with the fact they they couldn't fix it properly. They didn't compensate us for our inconvenience. Maybe it was out in the whole hotel - I didin't ask. Also, they use the huge room key system - so you turn the key in to the front desk when you leave. I like that but - there is no peephole on the room door or a security latch. Overall, I would recommend the hotel. The staff was very helpful in making dinner reservations for us before we arrived in Paris and helped us getting around the city.

Reviews.Title: “room 401”
Reviews.Author: kewflorida
Reviews.Content: Without being redundant, all the positive reviews of this hotel, I am in agreement with. We were in a room in the back of the hotel which was large, but the view was rather deadly. I asked and we were kindly moved, luggage and all, to room 401. The only room with a balcony. It wasn't huge, but the view was almost dreamlike. For the money this has to be one of the best deals in Paris. It was certainly the best I found after MUCH looking. I attached two pictures. The first is actually from the balcony, taken at night. The light is the Eiffel tower.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Peace in Paris”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We knew we'd barely be in our hotel so location was the most important thing. It's in a perfect spot for a first visit to Paris as so many of the tourist sights are in walking distance. But it's a great base for getting around if you want to get off the tourist trail too and in an ideal spot for soaking up the Left Bank atmosphere. Our room on the 5th floor was beautifully peaceful and air-conditioned. The rooms are small but if you've any sense you'll be doing nothing more than sleeping in there. The service was so polite and professional and everyone spoke English when our French wasn't up to the job. Thankfully we didn't need them but there was a stock of umbrellas by the door for guests to use too. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly lovely”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our three day stay here. It's a lovely hotel in the heart of the left bank, a stone's throw from Notre Dame. Greetings from the staff were warm and sincere. Fears of those rude French disappeared. We had room 301. Upon entering, my wife told me I couldn't have found a better hotel. Thank you TripAdvisor. It was small by American standards but we had plenty of space to put away luggage, etc. The room safe was good for keeping passports and cruise tickets. Our view of St. Severin's and the potted flowers just outside our window was gorgeous, although not everyone can have a room on the street. There are about 11 rooms with a courtyard view. We didn't see what they were like. The room was quiet at night except for an occassional siren. It is located in a lively area within walking distance of countless moderately priced restaurants. No reservations required. However, I wonder if we would've preferred a little less lively neighborhood but at 60 maybe that's my age talking. Taking the Metro to key attractions was simple. We relied on Gray Lines for a couple good introductory tours but we went to the Louvre on our own. We knew almost no French but had no problem wherever we went.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Henri IV for 5 nights. The location is fantastic. A couple of minutes from metro stations and a RER station. The hotel is also only a couple of minutes walk from Notre Dame. The hotel itself is great. A small friendly hotel without all the pretentiousness of some of the larger chains. We stayed in Rm 502 which had fantastic views of St Severin church. Previous reviewers have talked about the view of the church. From this room the view really is fantastic - the church is only metres away! The rooms themselves are very small. We had two large suitcases and struggled to not to have them in the way. That said you are in Paris and in truth should be out and about and not in your hotel room all day! The rooms were very clean, and the bathroom was small, clean but perfectly formed. The breakfast at the hotel is 11 euros but we felt worth it. There is not really a selection. Its simply cornflakes, bread, croissants, toast, fruit and coffee and orange juice. That said what you do get is good and some of the restaurants close by are significantly more expensive. The room has a minibar which is stocked. The drinks are usual mini bar prices. The location of the hotel is great. You are however very close to a quite trashy area, full of late night bars and tourist shops. That said we never had any impact from this either in noise or the usual tourist trail of beer cans etc the next morning. I would definately book to stay at the hotel again. The location is fantastic and the cleanliness of the rooms and public areas is spot on. In a perfect world the rooms would be bigger. This is however a minor criticism and would not stop me re-booking. You also get a free safe in the room which is handy. Tip - Try to get a 01 or 02 room preferably with a higher floor. The rooms are well sound proofed so don't worry about overlooking the main room. This way you will get the views of the church though.

Reviews.Title: “The hype lived up to it's name”
Reviews.Author: tryonemoretime
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed 6 nights at this hotel because of all the good reviews on this website. We were not disappointed! I was able to get the room I requested (602) which although a little small had a wonderful view of the Eiffel Tower. Every night we enjoyed looking out our window to see the tower and after 10:00pm every hour on the hour, it was lit up with sparkly lights. The place was clean, bathrooms really nice with an exepected luxury of a towel warmer. The location was fabulous. A few steps away is the Latin Quarter where there are literally over 50 restaurants to pick from for dinner and we didn't have a bad meal in any of them. There are also many quant cafes steps away for afternoon wine and cheese or breakfast. We used the Metro the whole time we were there and there are 2 stations very close by. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Funkyrabbit
Reviews.Content: Few affordable hotels in Paris could rival the Henri IV Rive Gauche Hotel in my opinion. It is located a stone's throw from the Notre Dame right in the heart of the Latin Quarter and the sfaff are so friendly and speak perfect English. My husband and I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights for our first wedding anniversary and we were not disappointed. This was our second stay in Paris and if we go back again, I will definitely stay here again. I felt so safe with the location and in the evening it was lovely to have a walk in the Latin Quarter as it is so lively. The Notre Dame is literally two streets away, which is really lovely. You also have a choice of metro stops nearby - very handy. We took the RER from Charles de Gaulle and from the St Michel stop, the hotel is a 5 minutes (if that) walk. The room was clean, nothing fancy but perfect - at the end of the day, on a city break all you want is something tidy and you don't spend much time in your room. We had twin beds, two wardrobes, a desk, chair and a telly in our room. The bathroom was fully tiled - beige marbles effect tiles, which was really nice and the shower was a good pressure too. We never had breakfast in the hotel, it would have cost 11 euros each but there is a lovely bakery just down Rue de la Huchette (2nd street on your left if you turn right out of the hotel), which does gorgeous croissant, orange juice and coffee at a much cheaper price. We booked our room via the hotel's own website: (---). I searched around but couldn't get a better deal than that. Would highly recommend a stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Maryjay60
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at this hotel for five nights in March. The hotel was perfectly clean and lovely. I had corresponded with them prior to our stay with some special requests, as my mother is elderly and this was her first trip to Paris, and they accommodated every need. The weather was awful and they supplied umbrellas at the door. The room we had seemed quite large by European standards, and had plenty of storage and room for our two large suitcases and assorted carryons. Some doubles have actual double beds, while others have two singles. If it matters to you, you can request which set-up you desire (as we did.) The elevator was working perfectly when we visited, and the helpful staff took care of our needs. I requested a wine bottle opener and had my bottle whisked away, opened and presented on a tray with wine glasses - certainly beyond my expectations. The public areas and rooms were clean, pleasant, and in excellent shape - no worn furnishings. Our room had a refrigerator and safe - both of which were easy to use. This place is a gem.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely recommend this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Meathmember
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our recent three night stay in Paris. This hotel was perfectly located, lots of restaurants nearby and a good Irish bar not too far either! The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was small but clean and comfortable. I would definitely go back there again and recommend to anyone looking for somewhere to stay in central Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Loved Henri IV Rive Gauche”
Reviews.Author: nrsimmons
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Henri IV Rive Gauche you are immediately greeted by a "bonjour" or "bonsoir." The front desk staff, Nathalie and Rose are exceptional. We were in room 502 and, yes it is a little small by American standards, but hey, it does the job! There are no key cards here folks! It is a key attached to a door knob like thing with the hotel's address engraved on the side in case it gets lost. Almost always, the front desk staff will ask you for the room key before you leave for the day. Call us a little crazy, but we walked everywhere from the hotel. The Notre Dame is a five minute walk. The Louve and Jardin de Tuleries are 15 minutes away if you are walking. The Champs Elysee and Arc de Triomphe are about 30-40 minutes away if you are walking. Nathalie had told us to take the RER to the Arc and Champs, but I was a little hesitant so we ended up walking. The Eiffel Tower is 40-45 minutes away. I think the best way to see Paris is on foot. The only time we took a taxi was when we got a little lost at Printemps on Blvd. Haussman. By then it was the end of our trip and I was tired of walking. Get the Paris map that has the Printemps 10% discount and you will never get lost. It has every little side street in Paris you can imagine. I used mine on a daily basis. It is in the hotel lobby. The breakfast is OK. It consists if Corn Flakes, croissants, rolls, coffee and OJ. It was a little steep at 11 euros, but it gives you that burst of energy to start the day. If you're a night owl, be aware the Nathalie and Rose leave round 7-8pm and the night crew comes in. They are there simply to watch over things and don't have as much as knowledge as Nathalie and Rose. At this time they lock the front door and you will have to be buzzed in. All in all I really liked this hotel and if I return to Paris I will return to Henri IV Rive Gauche. P.S. I recommend Cafe Panis and Le Depart. They are in close proximity to the hotel and the service is great.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: TripAdviserFan
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed at the Hotel Henri IV in April and we couldn't have been happier with our choice. We booked this hotel based on the other reviews I read on Trip Advisor and I was so thrilled we decided to stay here. What a great service Trip Advisor is! We were greeted by Rose at the front desk. Many previous reviews mentioned how nice both Rose and Natalie were, and they were right. Rose speaks perfect English and Natalie's isn't bad either. Our room was on the 4th floor and I'm happy to say that the elevator was working. A very nice bellman accompanied us to our room and showed us how everything worked. I was pleased to see a minibar in our room because I don't remember reading about that in any of the other reviews. Also, just like everyone before me said, the bathroom is very modern and the whole room was immaculate (old world style but modern at the same time). My favorite part was the windows that opened to the balcony overlooking the Rue St. Jacques. Yes, it was a little noisy with the windows opened, but I didn't care because it felt like the ultimate Paris experience. From our balcony we could see St. Severin directly across the street (this church is the setting for one of the scenes in The Da Vinci Code) as well as up and down the busy street. There are many wonderful shops and restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. Right next store is a creperie which had great crepes and sandwiches. Across the street and down a bit is a tiny little alleyway leading to about 20 restaurants of all different ethnicities (Greek, Italian, Mexican, Middle Eastern, etc). There's something for everyone. Notre Dame is just around the corner. Also around the corner is a cafe called Cafe Panis where we had wine and cheese at a table near the window where we watched the people walk by. It was a great experience. We did have breakfast in the hotel and it is pricy at 8 Euros, but it was convenient and tasty (rolls, croissants, fruit, cereal and delicious coffee with warm milk). Another thing we did was take the Paris Seinorama tour with Cityrama and I wasn't impressed by it. It was a 1 hour bus tour and 1 hour boat tour (the boat tour was boring and the boat itself was old, crowded and uncomfortable). The bus part of the tour was good as it took you to all of the highlights (Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysee, Arc de Triomphe, The Louvre, etc). I also want to mention that we had expected the French to be snobby and unfriendly to us because we're Americans and know very little French, but we found this to be completely untrue. 90% of the people we met in the shops, restaurants and on the tour were delightful. I think they are happy if you attempt a "bonjour" and then they are quick to respond in English. It was a great trip and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great for vacations in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ekehat
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our little vacation in Paris, and this hotel helped make it great. The best thing about this hotel is its excellent location. Steps away from the Notre Dame and Metro / RER station. Its location in the latin quarter makes sure you can enjoy the great restaurants and bars of the area, at any hour, and walk back to your room - no need for late night taxis. On top of that, the place is modern, clean and nicely decorated. The staff is great too - very nice and helpful, and all speak good English. The only problem was that the rooms are rather small, but that's the standard for boutique hotels in Paris. We didn't stay in our room much, so it didn't really bother us. In short, if you're going to Paris on vacation, then this place is highly recommended. We're definitely going to return there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: eskimo
Reviews.Content: I can't rate this hotel highly enough! My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in March to celebrate both our birthdays. I told the hotel this at the time of booking and they gave us room 602 to help make our stay more special. It was an attic/garret type room, very atmospheric with sloping ceilings and views of the cathedral and Eiffel Tower in the distance. The room itself was clean, reasonably spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was small but adequate. Even though we were on the main road the double glazing meant there was little street noise. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. The breakfasts were fine - no selection to speak of (cereal, juice, a roll and croissant each) with tea/coffee/hot chocolate but enough to get you started for the day. The location was perfect, both for walking and for transport connections. It was especially great for connections to Charles de Gaulle airport, top of the street and straight onto the train! The majority of the restaurants in the immediate area are Greek but you don't have to venture far to find others if that's not to your taste. All in all, it was a fantastic hotel. I've already recommended it to friends, will continue to do so and won't hesitate to stay there again when I next visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Myself and my fiance stayed at the hotel from 4th February for four nights. We had previously stayed in Paris in a hotel with a tiny bedrooms so this was a big improvement. The rooms are lovely, clean, and with good wardrobe space the bathroom has storage space. We had requested a room 501 as it has good views and this was provided no problem. The staff were very friendly, the location is just amazing, so close to notre dame We would definitily stay at this hotel when we go back to Paris

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and well-located”
Reviews.Author: LADreamer
Reviews.Content: This is not a "quaint" or "picturesque" hotel. Our fourth floor room, though small by American standards, was modern, clean, and quiet. With its easy proximity to Notre Dame, the Latin Quarter, and the Marais, the location really is quite convenient to many tourist destinations. The staff speaks excellent English, and could be counted on to make any necessary reservations. Now, this is in the heart of Tourist Central, so those seeking a more local flavor may prefer another location. You will encounter a lot of other American tourists at this hotel and in the general area. Also, for what it's worth, it seemed that too many of the food establishments in the immediate vicinity (with predominently tourist customers) were below average compared what we had experienced in other areas of the city. However, better food is only a few blocks away, and the nearness of the Metro makes the rest of Paris accessible. All in all, though, I would highly recommend this hotel for its comfort and convenience, especially for visitors looking for a pleasant place to lay one's head between hours of sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: KC305
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in early March. We were very pleased with our decision to stay there. Our room was on the top floor facing the church, it was spacious, the beds were extremely comfortable and the bathroom was modern and had a powerful shower. They also have wireless internet. The staff - Rose and Nathalie were extremely knowledgeable, helped us many times with reservations, taxis etc. We did not have breakfast in the hotel, as there were so many cafes nearby to choose from. The location is unbeatable, a couple of minutes walk to Notre Dame and a metro station. One day we took a taxi to the Arc de Triomphe, and walked all the way back, through the Champs Elysees, Tuileries, Louvre and across the river back to the hotel. I would highly recommend this hotel to other people because of price, location, service and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: SkaryKitty
Reviews.Content: Okay, I have to admit the location is great. But we had the smallest room on the lowest floor facing a light shaft with the window opening to the roof of the lobby. I could see the other guest room across and its bathroom as the woman in there was blow drying her hair. If you book this hotel, make sure to ask for a larger room on the upper floors or the ones facing the street. Otherwise, the hotel is clean and the staff helpful. But I can't believe this was rated so high. A little disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Henri IV in February 2006. It is exactly as the consensus of TripAdvisor members have stated: a fantastic value in a great location; clean and well-run; but not an eclectic boutique or luxury hotel. Here's the punchline: I've stayed at a lot of hotels, and few, if any, are a better value for the money: - The bed was comfortable. - Our room had a view of St. Severin and the Eiffel Tower. - Even overlooking the street we heard little street noise - The room was clean and the shower worked great. - All of the hotel, including our room and the common spaces, was modern, looked new, and was well-kept up. It's nice looking, and not shabby. - The staff handled our reservation with aplomb, gave us good suggestions for nearby restaurants the first night, stored our luggage for us on the last day, and were supremely friendly and nice. - The neighborhood was right next to Notre Dame, Ile de la Cite, the Latin Quarter, just a fantastic location for a tourist. The nearby surroundings were adorable. - For Paris, this place was unbelievably inexpensive for what we got. For those of you who are typically luxe travelers (and we're usually in that camp), this place: - is generically decorated; if it weren't for the view of St. Severin, we could've been anywhere - the room was small, but not as small as I thought it would be after reading about it on Tripadvisor. We had two overhead-bin size rolling bags and we were comfortable in the room. If we had two gargantuan suitcases, we would have felt cramped. - has no lobby of any merit. - has no concierge services that I would use; I didn't ask the front desk to make restaurant reservations; I did that. - doesn't have bathrobes, fancy soaps, or any of that. (But it did have soap, shampoo, etc, that seemed to get me clean just fine.) - was too American for my taste (this might be a plus for some of you, a minus for others). The front desk staff's English was *too* good. The other guests we ran into were all American. Overall, my wife and I have been heartily recommending this hotel to our friends. For us, the idea of spending 300 Euros more per night for a luxury hotel just wasn't worth it given the convenience, location, and quality of this hotel. But for many TripAdvisor readers, I suspect it would be. This hotel has great value. It will not pamper you.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RazzTazz23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Henri IV for a few days in Early March. The hotel is perfectly located, block from the river and a block from the RER and Metro station to the airport. If you are a first time visitor to Paris, the location is ideally located near all the attractions. The hotel is perfectly clean and staff is friendly and speaks English. We had a room facing the church across the street. There was no noise from the street. The room was perfectly clean but was very small which is pretty standard for Paris. The bed was comfortable, lots of hot water with the shower, and the warming rack for the towels was a nice touch. I used the computer in the basement several times for Internet access. If your looking for a nice, clean, ideally located hotel in Paris at a reasonable price, check it out. If you're looking for luxury, its probably not the place.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hpfl
Reviews.Content: We had a perfect 6 night stay at the Henri IV Rive Gauche. The location is ideal for tourists, right across the Seine from Notre Dame and walking distance to Blvd. St. Germain, the Louvre, Musee D'Orsay, the Rodin Museum, St. Chapelle, and the Invalides. It's not as quaint as some but very clean and in a great location. I have lots of experience with top-end hotels; this not that type of hotel but it became our home for the week and we felt very comfortable there. Rose at the front desk was amazing; she was extremely helpful and made dinner recommendations and reservations for us every evening. She also arranged airport transportation for us. It was so pleasant to see a smiling face and to be addressed with a "Bon Jour" every time we came in the door. They also have umbrellas available by the front door, something we used in February. Our room was decent size for Paris; it looks like room size does vary somewhat and we had requested a larger room. There was also quite a bit of storage - two large closets. As a previous poster noted, the elevator was out for part of our stay. OK, we walked up 4 short flights - perhaps a big deal for others but not for us. There was some occasional street noise but not enough to really disturb our sleep and the room was warm and comfortable. Some of the area is somewhat touristy, but it's easy to walk past anything that doesn't appeal. Paris is such a great walking city. Brassere Balzar is a good restaurants in walking distance and La Rotisserie d'en Face is excellent. The very best was Le Tastevin on Ile St Louis; we ate there twice. Even mid-week in February, reservations (if not required) were very much appreciated. I am on record as having some concerns with Trip Advisor reviews being "purchased" - these statements are mine alone. I'm very happy to present an unsolicited endorsement of Henri IV Rive Gauche. We will most definetly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Henri is okay”
Reviews.Author: tagretchen
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in February, and found it to be alright. However, at the time of our stay the hotel was listed as #4 in all of Paris on tripadvisor and it did not live up to that at all. Some positives: The hotel is close to Notre Dame, the metro and a very touristy area. Some negatives: The elevator was broken the whole time we were there. Our toilet was broken for a day. The rooms are small --typical of Europe. For the budget minded looking for a no frills place this hotel is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Perfect Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cleve59
Reviews.Content: We loved it and booked based on reviews contained herein. Only complaints: Wish they had a choice of pillows -- only foam rubber available. Cheap bathroom amenities - but that may be my American hotel experience talking. Rose and Nathalie at the front desk were helpful, patient and cheerful. We had room 501 with view of St. Severin and Eiffel Tower. Note: January-February was cold, but everything was open, sidewalk cafes had heaters, and there were no crowds. We walked to the Arc de Triomphe from the hotel - went to the Musee D'Orsay en route -- nobody around, no lines. The Tuilleries were a little bare, I must admit, but a small price to pay!

Reviews.Title: “True to all the reviews”
Reviews.Author: photomat3
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Paris and stayed at the Henri IV, thanks to the TripAdvisor reviews. Having read just about everyone of those reviews we felt like we already knew the place before we got there! It really is a very nice small hotel. The location can't be beat for a first trip to Paris or, in our case, a trip with a small child. You're literally steps to the metro, five minutes walk from Notre Dame, ten minutes from l'Hotel de Ville. We stayed on the sixth floor, with the great views of St. Severin and the Eiffel Tower. (I'll attach the view from the room.) The staff was quite helpful in booking taxis and recommending non-touristy places to eat. A special thanks to Rose who was so friendly that our two-year-old would ask to go down and see her. We look forward to retuning. The Henri IV completely lived up to its billing as a clean, friendly, little boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absoutely perfect. Situated on Rue St Jacque (I believe there is another hotel of same name), it is in the Latin Quarter, so close to Notre Dame and right on the bank of the Seine. The staff were all 1st rate. Their english was perfect, they were professional, obliging, friendly and nothing was a problem. We stayed 3 to a room, and they are beautiful luxurious rooms. The hotel is quite new and very tastefully decorated. No outside noise, and the continental breakfast was lovely, served in a relaxed environment complete with a variety of newspapers. We walked everywhere, including Mum who is 63 years old- so nothing is too far away... except Sacre Coer of course! We found a lovely cafe and supermarket across the road, bottle shop around the corner and a variety of restaurants. We missed out on the jazz bars, but ask reception and they will point you in the right direction. My only advice, if you are thinking of seeing Moulin Rouge??? is to go independently, not on a bus tour- as we 'thought' we were booked for the 9pm show, but were taken on a merry ride to look at city lights, then a boat up and down the river, before lining up for an hour for the 11pm show!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Not ideal, as this was our last night, hence no jazz bar.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews on Tripadvisor; my wife and I stayed here from 13-16 January. The hotel is in a perfect location; one block from Notre Dame and in the midst of the very vibrant Latin Quarter. The staff were very friendly and helpful, and the room was comfortable, clean, and ours had a view of the Eiffel Tower. There's a metro stop 2 minutes away, and loads of very good restaurants within a 3 block radius. We skipped the 11 Euro breakfast, opting for local bakeries (turns out price is about the same anyway). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would gladly recommend it. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Jan 8-11 and had a great time. I was very interested in staying at this hotel and experiencing the value of Trip Advisor recommendations since I had never used TA before. I’m not a small hotel person I like a more full service hotel with lots of amenities (gym, restaurant, bar, office services, etc...) Henry the 4th did not have this. However it was very nice, clean, great staff very friendly especially Rose at the front desk, great English and very helpful. Hot pot of coffee delivered to my room in the morning, 3 euros was great. The location was very good from a sight seeing perspective close to many of the attractions and very good shopping behind Notra Dame. The area right around the hotel was packed with inexpensive restaurants and shops that all sold the same trinkets, not a fan of that kind of environment but it was fun to people watch. There was a killer restaurant at the end of the block across the street from Notra Dame that had live music at night. One night they had a little Jazz trio and the other nights they had a great piano player. Relax listen to a little music with a nice bottle of wine. I stayed in room 303 with my 80 year old father we had two small beds in a very small room with no view, which was fine because it eliminated any street noise and we really only were there to sleep. Based on this experience I would use TA again on my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pairsian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jake V
Reviews.Content: Great overall experience at this hotel. Staff was as friendly as could be. Everything was fresh and very clean and the attention to detail (potted plants on the courtyard; hotel always smelled great) made the difference. In Parisian style, rooms are not American sized, but exactly as I expected. All the necessary services were available and there are plenty of food, drink and shopping choices nearby when you just want to duck out for a glass of wine, a crepe or a couple bottles of water. And a reasonably priced minibar was the surprise hit. I will stay here next time I head to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: LaureninDC
Reviews.Content: Henri IV Rive Gauche was perfect for what we needed. It was very clean, well located, and the employees were oh so friendly. If you are looking for fine toiletries and all the extras that come with a top hotel this may not be the place you want to stay. But, if you are looking for a very clean, well located, friendly, comfortable hotel,this is it. The breakfast was just fine if you don't feel like making a production of finding a restaurant, fresh OJ, croissants and rolls, fruit, cereal, yogurt.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Central Location”
Reviews.Author: FortMcMurray101
Reviews.Content: After months of internet research, we finally settled on the Henri IV Rive Gauche for our first trip to Paris and spent 11 nights in total, mid to late October, 2005. We were extremely pleased with our decision. Rooms were spotless, tastefully decorated, and, while not large, were more than adequate for 2 adults plus luggage. The mini bar fridge was handy for a small amount of cheap snacks and drinks purchased at a local supermarket. We stayed in #602 for 7 nights, went to Normandy for a few days, then checked in to #502 for last 4 nights. Location could not be more central; you are in the heart of the city. This has its positives (convenience, can walk everywhere, stone's throw to major sites like Notre Dame, Louvre, etc) however, the downside is that the area is extremely touristy. As we were there mid-autumn, it was not too bad, although there were still plenty of tour groups to contend with in the immediate vicinty. Proximity to the metro is excellent, and on future trips to Paris I will use it more often as it is cheap, clean, safe, convenient and gets you where you want to go fast. However this being our first time in Paris, we walked EVERYWHERE on the left bank, and much of the right bank, and it was well worth the tired feet (bring excellent shoes, ie: Clark's are great). This is the best way to see the city's beautiful sites, amazing architecture, and to get a real sense of the people and the culture. We made sure to visit all the big attractions but spent at least as much time OFF the beaten path, in order to fully appreciate the city. The hotel staff were great; very friendly, spoke excellent English and were not at all patronizing when we practiced our limited French on them. They were very accommodating when we asked to store 2 suitcases and some packages when we departed for Normandy for a few days, rather than drag all our stuff with us on the train and from hotel to hotel. Our belongings were intact when we returned for the remainder of our stay, including a baggie of approx. $150 Canadian in Euro coins (in an unlocked front pouch) that I had forgotten to take along. One day we returned to the hotel with takeout, and seated ourselves in the breakfast area where some of the staff were having their lunch break. One of the housekeeping attendants jumped right up from eating her lunch to come over and offer us something to drink. This kind of attentiveness and courtesy was consistently displayed throughout our stay. I cannot comment on the hotel breakfast, as each morning we would enjoy our breakfast of take-out cafe au lait and pain au chocolate seated on a park bench at Luxembourg Gardens. So my only unenthusiatic comment might be the cost of the breakfast which seemed high, however in all fairness, may have been well worth it. Overall an excellent stay in a beautiful city. My only hesitation in returning to this hotel would be my desire to check out other spots in different neighbourhoods, however I have absolutely no complaints and only fond memories of the Henri IV Rive Gauche.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - amazing location!”
Reviews.Author: vlmail2
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed at the Hotel Henri IV RIve Gauche Nov. 24-28 and enjoyed it very much. We had a room with two twin beds on the first floor (one up form ground level), directly across from St. Severin. What a view each day! The two beds were pushed together, but we were able to pull them apart a few inches to pull out sheets and comforters. The room was quite spacious, even compared to my experiences with hotels in the US. The bathroom was adequate in size and cute in a funny way. (Yes, the sink really looks just like the picture on their website!) As someone else posted, the shower door is kind of strange - only spans halfway across the length of the tub. The trick to not flooding the room is keep the shower head low and pointed away from the shower door. There was a mini-bar with extra space for a few bottles and some cheese/snacks. Everything was very clean and quiet - I wondered if we were the only guests until I saw some others at breakfast one day! We didn't really need assistance from the front desk, beyond ordering a taxi for our departure, but each person there was very pleasant. We did have breakfast at the hotel most mornings; expensive, yes, but worth every penny to not go out in the cold to search for morning coffee! Finally, location, location, location. Several metro stops within a couple blocks, Notre Dame and the Seine two blocks north, shops, quick eats and restaurants for blocks surrounding the hotel - c'est parfait! I'm not adding any photos as the ones on the website are *exactly* how the hotel looks.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: aar4
Reviews.Content: The Henri IV is an immaculately clean and very pleasant hotel with an accommodating staff that speaks excellent English but was gracious enough to converse with me in my not-so-excellent French. There are four rooms on each floor (24 rooms in all). Try for a room on the 5th or 6th floor ending in 01 or 02. The 02 rooms(we were in that one) are small; the 01 rooms larger. The 03 and 04 rooms do not have the views of St. Severin or the distant views of the Eiffel Tower. In November 05, at least, all rooms were the same price (160 Euros, about $200.) Yes, it's a touristy area: 2 blocks from Place St. Michel and on a busy street leading from Ile de la Cite (Notre Dame) to Boul. St. Germain. But it's good value if you don't mind the small room.

HotelInfo.Name: Henri IV Rive Gauche Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 9-11 rue Saint Jacques | 05 Arr., 75005 Paris, France
